eb0q_goypG_kB4oLsK_85A.text: Great happy hour specials, would not go any other time of day. That is the key for this place if you don't want to pay for over-priced Mexican food. The happy hour mini nachos, are by no means mini. They are great to share with someone, tasty with fresh ingredients for only $5! Most of their happy hour foods are $5 per plate. We saw the taquitos being catered out, and those looked delicious as well. The upstairs rooftop patio is better for seating than inside. Inside tends to be pitch dark.

I41kM0s7ichj77-vt-6Fug.text: Food got worse since first trip here a year ago. Came again for huevos rancheros, price went up, eggs were way overcooked, couldn't accommodate over easy eggs at all. They updated their breakfast menu but didn't update or take off old menu items, ordered breakfast skillet and then after waiting 10 minutes later was told they couldn't make my order and I had to order something else. I think the waiter should have known this and told me right away instead of waiting and having to reorder. Saving grace is the salsa it's amazing. Nice atmosphere for drinks, but disappointed in the change in the food.

zIA1dnd4RaWl5q_jBq6xZg.text: We had fabulous Super Bowl experience in the bar. Sean the manager came over to see if everything was ok a few times. Tamera was our waitress and did a superb job. All in all, they made our Super Bowl Sunday very memorable!  Dan and Kim Stromen

YghlBaiL_mDsUuaM04OIDw.text: Christina was a great server and was extremely attentive and helpful! She has great energy and made this a great evening out!

2zp4fUXDR1lBOsmV6VwPmg.text: Our server Christina was great. She's bomb.com Our $3.50 coffees served in little Styrofoam cups weren't. I'm sorry but coffee mugs should be abundant in a big restaurant like this that serves breakfast. Otherwise the Chayo breakfast which had 2 types of chilaquilles was good and filling. I guess the coffee thing bugged me...meh

5zyRMgU_6fVv4wZA8hQ2QQ.text: Haven't tried the food, but the review is a reflection of the good dance music they were playing and no cover charge. Always a good combination!

roYahaqJTQoFcxmRxHhFJg.text: The food is delicious. The location is awesome. The atmosphere is perfect. I've had the breakfast skillet and enchiladas. Both were yummy. Our server could have been more attentive. Had to ask a few times for things. I will be back for sure.

QgW_5sIV8B_348NENEwr_g.text: Went there on a Saturday. They have a live DJ and he was playing good music. I had a mojito it was good. Ordered the lobster tacos. The lobster meat was kinda cold, tough and very salty.  The tortillas that housed the tacos was cold and had a strange gummy texture.  The rice was not a Mexican rice but rather just plain steamed white rice, which was ok with me but was strange. The pinto beans meh.. No chips and salsa was given to us but I did see it on other tables, so I don't know if our waiter forgot or if it was by request..

bHCtBOyCn2P9EEeedmpA3w.text: We stoped in for a couple of margaritas.  They were really good.  It was an ok place for a drink decent prices.

3zzXxtfIFAXKvTcESLnzZw.text: my fiance and i has been to this restaurant several times, because they serve great food there's not a time that we're were visiting in Vegas that we don't come to this restaurant however I would like to give a great compliment and huge recommendation to all seeking great quality Mexican Cuisine and if she's working please ask for Erica E she was an awesome server there was not a time we had to request that our server come back to our table she made sure we where is served properly and satisfied.

k468n0g1fjJAzmsCXiTvEw.text: We came for Matt Franco and a dinner show on one ticket. Little did we know when we bought the dinner addition it was a "pre-fix". The prefix is when they give you a choice of only a few dinners. My partner had veggie enchiladas and I had chicken soft tacos. Her enchiladas were stuffed with butternut squash and we're so insipidly sweet they were almost inedible. My tacos were served on a rack and the corn tortillas had been steamed. As a result, the bottoms fell totally apart when I try to pick them up so I had to eat my tacos on the plate with a fork. Now I think the most frustrating part about having a "prefix", was the fact that they would not bring us any extra of the usual condiments in a Mexican restaurant. I asked the waiter before the meal came out if we could have a little extra salsa, he looked at me in a very puzzled manner and never did answer me and never did bring any salsa. In fact when I had my initial salad I asked a server for pepper. Again I never even got pepper! We even offered to pay for chips and salsa and again got that puzzled look from the waiter. The food was average, but I like to hold my taco in my hand and my partners food was so one note and sweet that some salsa would help to elevate it or even a long time. Just not as impressed as I wanted to be it was over $60 when all was said and done. Certainly won't come back here when there's better Mexican food of the strip.

SBKzyat4zLqu8qmff7_SFQ.text: Horrible service. Food OK, not great. Much better options on the strip.  Waited for 10 minutes after being seated and had to flag down a server because nobody was helping us. Dude never checked up on us the entire time we were there. Had to flag him down again because we had received our food and no napkins or utensils. And then they bring one napkin for two people. Jackasses!   Ive worked in restaurants for 20 years, so I left a small tip, anyways. But this dude didn't deserve a penny.  Won't be eating here again!

Ta7TYNv4I__MtR5r8aJtEA.text: Ok, I'm not a snob by all means and I'm also in the service industry... but Jesus!! This place!! Not being funny but seriously... where to begin... there were four of us. first we get sat down and we had been at the pool all day so we were super thirsty, told the server jokingly "we're super parched" he said cool got you....we also ordered cocktails at the same time, never got water, had to ask a busser, busser brought three waters after 30 min, my husband still hadn't got his drink, when his drink came (it was a bloody beer) it was flat and warm. We ordered a app of calamari... it came, it was burnt, taste like cardboard... Lance the server said no biggie, and got us a fondido with chorizo, (still haven't had our order taken) we also asked for extra tortillas, that never happened.... lance came back about 20 minutes later and said sorry he had to take an order of 100, and pointed to a party of 12 in the back... that's cool... we understand, he might be new... I told him don't worry about the tortillas we're just ready to order.... ok one of us ordered the nachos with chorizo... food came about 45 minutes later, no chorizo, mine was cold (diablo shrimp) , he finally checked on us... we told us the problem reluctantly and he took my food, never asked if I wanted something else... just walked away. I asked him if Cesar was the new executive chef... lance said he honestly doesn't know, he's not allowed in the back... wtf haha ok bud... poor lance...  last.... I asked where the bathroom was after we payed the bill ($120 apx) they told us sorry you gotta go next door at the flamingo... errr k... we just left.... suck suck suck.... smh next time we will just stick to bar food at the tilted kilt or off the strip... we love the linq..."GOD DAMMIT LANCE!" .... a visit to giggle about... not all his fault.... probably bad training

Fm19GOBsWRasANWZ_qSVyw.text: Christina was absolutely awesome! She should be manger of this place because she knows how to take care of people!

KMtNTOT2pztGnPVg1zdI0A.text: Great cuatomer service.  Ask for Ivan. Loved the guacamole and los tacos de carnitas.

FtfkQHzmGz7th9ts8AcjXQ.text: This place is great!  We came here twice during our stay (at the Flamingo) - once for cocktails & apps, once for lunch, and both times were great!  They have an amazing and extensive margarita menu.  I tried like 4 different ones and there were all delicious!!  Their guacamole is grub! The place is in a great location and prices are reasonable (for Vegas).  I would highly recommend it if you're in the mood for margaritas & Mexican food.

b_CWo7Q_uOx0cow4WLDWOw.text: On New Year's Day, my family and I came here for breakfast but they didn't only served lunch and dinner. There were vintage orange cushion leather booths and wooden tables surrounding a mechanical bull in the middle of the restaurant. The restaurant was decorated with hollow lights, colorful skulls, crosses, and prints of bulls.   The drinks especially the Pina Colada and Sangria were very strong! The Pina Colada, which consisted of rum, pineapple juice and coconut cream, tasted like medicine due to excessive rum. I asked them to make a lighter and more sweet version of it. The second was better than the first. The Sangria consisted of red wine, brandy, and fresh fruit juices. They were garnished with strawberry and orange.   For appetizers, I'd recommend the Guacamole (and tortilla chips), Yucca Fries, Botana Platter, and Caesar Salad. The Guacamole dip consisted of fresh avocado, diced onions, parsley, and garnished with pomegranate seeds. Some of the tortilla chips were seasoned with spices. The Yucca Fries were deep fried, thickly cut yucca. The Botana Platter consisted of two mini pork chorizo and black bean sopes topped with radish, two crispy corn, poblano pepper, and cheese empanadas, and two chicken, cheese, shredded lettuce, and sour cream gorditas. The Caesar Salad consisted of fresh romaine lettuce and parmesan cheese tossed in a creamy anchovy dressing. The other guests in our party ordered Beer Battered Lobster Tacos and Sweet Corn Enchiladas. The Lobster Tacos, which came in 3 and consisted of beer battered lobster, beans, red cabbage, and topped with chipotle mayo. The Sweet Corn Enchiladas which came in 4, consisted of sweet corn, cheese, green peppers, and mushrooms, and topped with cascabel sauce, sour cream, and chives. It's a perfect option for a vegetarian!

dqet4_wZvDqJm9se-0Zoiw.text: Service was excellent and the food was ok. Got the prime rib, Carne Asada, chicken club and a plain cheese quesadilla for the kid. The fries were soggy on the club sandwich and with the carne Asada. The kid loved his plain cheese quesadilla and the kid liked his club sandwich but hated his soggy fries. The carne Asada was ok and the prime rib was ok as well as nothing special about them especially for the price.

Hfh4ekw2XfIU0m-Disix6g.text: Love it here. Come every time we are in Vegas! Great service great food even better drinks.

LtRTeXAieqzcY7_p49qgAg.text: Joey, our server, was great! The food is great! Awesome vegetarian options! Definitely a thumbs up.

xOtXl7kucbv5IjaA5G58ww.text: The food was fantastic! The steak burrito was off the charts! Christina was an incredible server: polite and quick. The best!

-OIK_hKmDxPw4kH230xsgg.text: All about the service. Was here once before and very average. Came back (meeting spot for a friend) much better service. 1 concern, portion sizes seem to be on the very small side. I'm not 280lb guy, but the 3 tacos are rather small. Like the 3 tacos sizes you would get from Taco Bell. Quality, yeah, head and shoulders better than that, but just about the same size. Good, just small for the money.

a706mA7ASzanCB57NliNqA.text: Love it here!!! Been coming to this place for over a year. Samantha and Patty always been nice and recommend really good drinks... I recommend it!!! The food is fantastic.

pkDQYdfy_fXKE38S51s-rw.text: The food was tasty, but some people should not be in the food server business. Our poor waitress seemed overwhelmed with the few customers she had.

xvRv9MkxNBPay7lSCBMmlg.text: Worse hostesses  bad service terrible food your better off going to Roberto's to be treated like a fast food joint two thumbs down save your money go elsewhere!!

fwJDx_e-V5VMPJ9aHjl_Cw.text: Chayo is next to The Linq and offers fresh, gourmet Mexican fare. Great place to stop and grab a bite after riding the High Roller. I do have to say though, Christina was AMAZING! Super sweet, fast, checked in with us and always made sure our drinks were refilled. The food is really good but she made the experience memorable!!!! If you go ask to be seated with her- she'll make sure you're taken care of! If you're reading this,thanks for the incredible service Christina!!!!!!

TH492P4enZHfxiu_aY4xLQ.text: This place is hands down awesome! Food is great & the ambiance is sexy. I'm a picky f* when it comes to margaritas... (No complaints here!) All I have to say is come check it out for yourself! 5 stars from me. Oh, the DJ was in point also.

qZytBnYjDDR_WTfCe9b5xA.text: The appitisers were great as well as the margaritas. Wasn't really crowed at 4:00 but seemed to be rushed to leave. The servers were busy and anything they forgot IE: sour cream you had at least a 15 minute wait. I would return main courses were average though. I believe the fun starts later when someone starts to ride the electric bull

CLQEfw5oPOvaIig_VBQjfA.text: We stumbled into this place and were pleasantly surprised. Margaritas were excellent and the carnitas tacos were yummy.   Christina did a great attentive serving job and made us feel welcome.

LFTvDlJTpwWqpj_MrcdDgw.text: I'll give it one star because the table side guacamole was excellent! Otherwise service was horrible and meal not so great! So many other places to go in Vegas besides here!!

CeAjVABdOfrWFbXAvtfSaA.text: Great spot to eat! We were seated quicky and food was delicious, but our server Christina made it the best experience! She was friendly, helpful and super quick and on top of any and all of our dining needs! Best service I've had in Vegas for our whole trip! She's a keeper!

zHHKsmEya-NqVLO0jqvXKw.text: This place is so much fun with an amazing atmosphere!!! All of our food was delicious and the cocktails are amazing. A really cool twist on Mexican food.  Definately recommend checking it out for a good time!

sQm7V37-0zsIj__--RWrPQ.text: We were pretty much shunned and blacklisted for using a groupon lol. Horrible customer service, food wasn't much better. Literally the first time in my life i haven't left a tip. I've been living here for close to 10 years, always eat out at restaurants, and work in the industry down the road dealing with guests on a daily basis and i always auto-tip even if the service is terrible, NOT THIS TIME. The food wasn't as bad as the service we received (would be pretty hard to top) but i would say its pretty average mexican food at best. Told our server we were using a groupon and she tried talking us out of using it for some reason?? Had i known now the service using a groupon gets you i would've gladly paid whatever, not the point though. Waitress never told us her name (wish she had now so i could put it in here) and once we were done haggling with her about the groupon she took our orders and that was literally the last we heard from her. Never checked on us once, we had to flag down a bus boy to bring us plates, we waited forever, and then all the food came out together. When's the last time you've been to a mexican restaurant and they brought out the chips and salsa at the same time as your entree, think about that? The best part was when the food runner came out and was like "oh, you guys are the groupon right" as if she had gone back and announced it to the kitchen like the beverly hillbillies or cheapskates were here. Manager on the way out seemed like he already knew who we were talking about as he didn't ask for her name. He offered us free drinks and stuff for next time which was nice but unfortunately there will be no next time... Sucks too because i really wanted to like this place.

pP0ttIxjHxluSBij8ghGyQ.text: This place is awful!! Do NOT go!!! My friend and I went on a Sunday night. The location is perfect. The decorations are beautiful. It has great potential. We sat on the patio and our server came over right away. That's were it started going downhill. We didn't order cocktails but did order an appetizer. Our server ignored us for the rest of the night and we had to literally ask him if we could order our entrees. The tacos we got were so dry and we didn't want to even eat them except that it took so long to get them that we were starving! Afterwards, we asked for the manager and he did give us a discount and made the server apologize, but it came off so fake and he didn't even bother to make up a fake excuse for his attitude... I would not come back here ever, nor would I recommend it to anyone, local or visiting!

c2VbQUZd_TIzCZDxxIZbgQ.text: Well where do I start. We were seated quickly and it took about 5 minutes for our server to even greet us. She asked if we wanted chips and salsa and assuming that this was like %99.99999 of other restaurants we said sure. Thanks for charging us for chips and salsa. I'm a chef and the cost of this is negligible and yet they nickel and dime you on this??? I'd advise bringing in a garden hose or a trough of water because they obviously don't get the concept of thirst here. I will say the short rib was awesome!!! The food was good and all but the service took away from the experience...

vJ7ctdw9Pwokh1Ey1vMRQg.text: Chayo is one of the best and most affordable places In Las Vegas. It is new and still trying to find it's footing in this huge culinary city, but it is amazing. Sometimes service is a little slow, but every single item on the menu (especially the lobster tacos) are amazing.

LNVipcnck0FHbmDq4h_Feg.text: Came here 1/4/14 with a rather large group for dinner without reservations. From  the outside it looks great! Stone front, heaters and outdoor seating. Once inside, it is a very intimate setting with dim lights, like that of "fine dinning". This place, mind you, is brand spankin' new! Even has the new smell. So far so good right?   Wellllll, for starters my group ordered a "pitcher" of Mexican Mule. Took awhile to recieve our pitcher, and when we did receive it, I was not happy with what I saw. First off, they bring out several glass with filled with ice and a straw of course. Secondly, the so called "pitcher" is not how I imagined it, like a traditional beer pitcher, but oh well. Thats not the really problem. What I was not happy with was the fact that the pitcher was more than half way filled ice (mind you there was already ice in the glass they brought). Basically this pitcher is really ice on ice! Equivilent of 3 and a half drinks! The drink was good, I give them that. But I had to remove the ice from the pitcher and poor the rest of the cocktail into a seperate glass, because the ice in the pitcher kept pouring out.  Now, the food. I ordered the Flank Steak with Yucca Fries and Chimichurri. And it was just, it just fell short. The steak was cooked well done but it had no taste. Even though it says "chimichurri", those flavors were nonexistent. The only tasty thing on my plate was the yucca fries. The Boyfriend ordered the Pork Sopes, which I did in fact try, the chorizo was way overcooked, and greasy. Very unpleasant to say the least.  Our servers were great, I cannot deny that. Overall Chayo's food is very bland, under seasoned and pitcher drinks are not worth it at all.

UTDsa-54VOTn6YROWSGUnw.text: We were in town for a bachelorette party and it was our big night out on the town. After the High Roller, we walked down expecting out rooftop patio to be all ready for us at Chayo (as I requested in my reservation). I called several days before the reservation to confirm the patio. When we arrived, the server brought us into the restaurant and sat us in the main area. I asked to speak with the bar manager, Cary, and he informed me that the patio was closed. I was frustrated that no one had called to inform me that my reservation had changed, and Cary completely understood. He actually opened up the rooftop patio just for our group!   AWESOME customer service and way to make the night special. We had the whole patio to ourselves, amazing server Malorie was on top of everything, and the food was good. It turned out to be the perfect setting for us!   The food is worthy of 4 stars. Service is worthy of 5 stars! Environment gets 5 stars. Unknown staff that failed to follow up with me regarding my reservation gets 1 star.  I will return next time I'm in Vegas!

-OZX1opbW_Z8rxKTG81TFA.text: Fidel was amazing. Tentative, got our food out to us quickly and we drank bottomless mimosas until we couldn't stand! Thank you!!!!!

97my4qDrrmRG4jivGU-lTw.text: Good happy hour. Tacos were delicious. We sat upstairs on the roof top. Only thing missing was music playing.

It was bad but I drank it cuz it cost a lot. The food was lackluster too the point I didn't even bothering taking photos. One person in our party ordered carne asada fajitas and it came in chunks. Gross. The service was terrible. Our server seemed very intense and they came over every 5 minutes basically trying to get us to leave

1SP0Xr3n1rMTFMqeOwmpWQ.text: Didn't enjoy my experience.  First of all, chips and salsa are on the menu as an appetizer for $6.  Clearly Chayo didn't get the memo that chips and salsa are free with purchase of an entree.  You know, like every other Mexican place on Earth.  By the way, the bill was $114 + the $20 bill I put along with my debit card - the server assumed this was his tip and didn't apply it to the bill.  Brilliant.  I was going to write your tip on the GRATUITY line.  When I ordered the triple berry mojito, I requested no mint; the passive-aggressive male server got closer to me and stated "then it's not a Mojito" - As if I was critiquing his personal recipe.  I don't care if it's a Mojito or not and I really don't care to talk about cocktail semantics with you; just take my order and go away.  I repeated that I didn't want mint leaves in my drink, which he again replied "then it's not a Mojito..."  I ended up ordering the $14 cocktail with the mint leaves that I didn't want so he would go away and I could get on with my day.  Ordered carne asada tacos: 3/4 of the meat was greasy ground beef, the rest being small pieces of actual carne asada.  I planned to bring this up to the server, but expected I would have to get into another debate; which at this point would have made me lose my temper and make a scene.  So I just muddled through the meal and went on with my life.  I know the server's name, but won't put it here because I have the slightest bit of decorum that he lacks.  But his parents are from DALLAS, Texas.  I'd assume the high reviews of this place are from infatuated tourists who don't know decent Mexican food.

Og91NlH75VQ3cMEXFihmHg.text: This place was attached to the hotel/casino we stayed at so it was convenient. We actually ate here twice. The prices were high but everything in Vegas is expensive so it was in line with other similar restaurants. The first night the service was somewhat slow. The portions were generous and plenty big enough. The next day was Cinco de Mayo and they didn't have any specials. What Mexican restaurants don't have specials on cinco de Mayo?!? That was a huge disappointment for me. Food is good and service is ok. They could do better though.

eht7uoXT-pfFJAxVSX-Khg.text: This spot plays good Latin music. Has a mechanical bull, although there is a $10 fee to ride it.. probably due to the high electrical cost to operate it haha. Probably took like 20 min for me to get a drink at the bar. I'd recommend it if you were looking for a cool place to dance Latin music

mdQaGGwWDYXFOY33UOQKHQ.text: Christina is the best!!! We will be coming back just to see her! Everything she recommended was delicious and she made us feel like family.

Zmo-C9lUpXOvtUOxvYBgrw.text: We loved the food soo much that we ate here 3 times last week during vacation! My cousin loved the shrimp ceviche and I loved the blackened salmon tacos. The only complaint I have is not once did I have a good drink. The margaritas were very tarty and the cucumber one was just gross. The food and service was good though.

6Gyq24yg81VI4eK2eHg4HA.text: Had brunch here. Super tasty food. Authentic and delicious. Wasn't too heavy, yet filling. Lots of large group tables but service stayed on top of it. Masih was chill and stayed attentive to the table. The reason it's a 4 star, we wanted to sit outside but we were strongly encouraged to sit inside and it took 3 requests for coffee for one person at our table. Overall I'd definitely suggest eating here.

RbTj2LNyYWTDX3nsyXUq9Q.text: Great Bloody Marys! We went for Sunday brunch and I had the breakfast burrito and it was very tasty...but rather small for the price. They had outdoor seating which was lovely. We sat at the bar and all of the bartenders were very attentive.

X1N4meZcAkTtCkuX9R4cCA.text: Christina is the bomb!! Will be back just for her!!  love the mole enchiladas too!  We come here every time we are in Vegas. It never disappoints. Great drinks, chips and salsa, and food. The Chayo margarita is fantastic!

iKCoaBHafAZL6IAdJUa3jQ.text: One the several good restaurants on promenade between Flamingo and The Linq. The mole was outstanding and my grilled shrimp burrito was very tasty. Good service, quality ingredients, and diverse menu. Enjoy the people screaming overhead as they zip line over you, don't worry there's a canopy.

3j1NuKTVZH6exkqrvljOxg.text: We were in Las Vegas to take our dog to the vet. He was having testing and we had a couple of hours. Off to Chayo for breakfast. Sarah was there but we didn't see her. She is outstanding. We met Tony. He, too, is outstanding. This is just a wonderful place to go to. The food is really good. The staff is great.

nn02Sb2LO3FDgmlzsmpUhg.text: The environment is good but the service was soooo slow and it wasn't even busy one of the things we got was a carne asada  quesadilla,  it had this really good cilantro lime sauce so we asked for some more on the side and it seriously took over 30 minutes to get a side of sauce our quesadillas were cold by then an we asked multiple people and they said " its coming" .to get a gingeral we asked two people , they walked away and we didn't get it for 20 minutes I really love the spongy fluffy  batter on Chile  relleno so that's what I ordered but it was a crusty cornmeal coating and was sitting in a pool of tomatillo sauce which I don't like sooo...yeah.if u know and like Mexican food,  find a mom and pop shop this is American Mexican fusion

1q4KqbKRYHejwGNhJga5yg.text: Came here because of our Tickets 4 less dining card and was not disappointed!  We both got the short rib enchiladas and. Mexican Sunset to wash it down. Delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Background of inside the restaurant!

fND8jK6kneL10kZcuexnSA.text: Made reservations. Wasn't needed for a Friday night at 8pm on Feb 15th. Not too busy inside was seated right away. No free chips and salads which I think is a must in all mexican restaurants. Had to order for $5.95. Tasted good though. Salsa was spicy.   Ordered the green enchilada and the short rib enchilada. Huge portions. Rice and beans were flavourful and not just filler. Good amount of meat inside the enchiladas as well. Also ordered a pitcher of red sangria. This was good as well. Good mix and balance of alcohol and mixed juices. Would come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green chicken enchiladas and Red short rib enchiladas.

WFDEHSVMBACDhCjtffmx3w.text: Food was awesome and our server Mya was very sweet. She was very personable and very attentive. We will definitely come again next time we are in town.  Danny, Shane, Shannon, and Jenifer

bwIUC5fb3L8eTGlSDfLhog.text: The Coconut Margarita was the best margarita I've ever had. The next time I go back to Vegas, I'll be coming back here to get it again!

gy7hibr2L20hanko3qvj6w.text: Service wasn't good. Food was not great at all. Had the chilaquiles and the Asada omelet, does not taste like good Mexican foos

bLvE7r6xuuJxfkoi5C4bww.text: Perhaps I am biased being from San Diego, but this is by far some of the most disappointing Mexican food I've ever had.  For starters the menu was completely different from what a lot of other Yelpers have posted; there was no seafood at all. I ordered carnitas tacos and it was mostly just fat. They pride themselves on the best margaritas, but they were just average.  On top of it all, super slow service and it wasn't even busy. Won't be back.

LHfhaULD8pRhHMD_TQNe0A.text: Love the atmosphere and everything about this place. Very good food. Margaritas are strong! I can't finish one myself without watering it down. LoL! The mechanical bull in the middle of the restaurant is a nice touch. I'm going to get on it one day! Servers are top notch. They always know their menus. I did have one inconvenience last time I was there. They were having a private party and I guess when this happens only the private party has access to the restrooms. They directed me across the way to Flamingo hotel. Not a far walk. But kinda odd.  Other than that all good! We will be back and I recommend going here. Try the BlackBerry matgaritas! Yum!

N18EXTZyv_dAPMC1GoaYuw.text: We just came here for drinks during happy hour. $5 margaritas were good and strong. We didn't order and food but they food coming out to other tables looked delicious. They also had decent food prices for happy hour. They rooftop view is amazing though. It's nice to sit up high and watch people walk the promenade. The only part I didn't like was our server must have went on break because for 20+ nobody came to our table to get us another round or bring the check until I flagged another server down.

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view

1bneSrmzCVJc4GfQZ1Lh6A.text: I came into this restaurant with a very high recommendation from a close friend.  I sat down at the bar since it was Sunday afternoon and the games were on, so I thought I'd be part of the fun group at the bar.  I don't know if it was in the wrong seat or what, but it seemed like I was in the one place that got skipped when it came to service.  After the two girls sitting next to me, which arrived after I did, got served, I was asked if I needed anything.  I requested a menu and some water.  I was pretty hungry and wanted to have a fun afternoon out on my own.  I ordered the chips and guacamole, which was very tasty.  I ordered two shots of tequila to help celebrate and they were nice.  They have a great tequila selection, so this was a plus!  When my lunch arrived, chicken enchiladas en mole, I was in heaven.  They were cooked very well and the flavor was excellent.  It just seemed to take a while to get waited on considering I was at the bar and it was mid afternoon.  I look forward to coming back for more tequila on my next visit but I might just sit down at a table instead.

iA9r3VYnatH5FQo4cMegZA.text: Great food, great overall experience. I came in Friday morning just as they were opening, with a severe case of jet lag. Plopped on a barstool in a fog, and braced myself for a typical Las Vegas Tourist interaction complete with imitation Mexican food, strained smiles, and forced banter from the server. I wasn't ready for the bartender, George.  George greeted me with a warm smile, friendly conversation, and menu recommendations based on our conversation. The food arrived promptly, with good presentation and excellent flavor. I enjoyed the meal, but the excellent service provided by George turned an expected jet lagged just-another-meal into a great experience that put a shine on the rest of my day. Go here. Sit at the bar. And experience something that is all too rare. Great food and drink served by George, someone who genuinely seems to care about your experience.

n3Z7VCY5sud3uNENE9yEgw.text: Just was there at 4:15. Not crowded at all plenty of seats. They took us back to a remote corner all alone. I asked to be moved to where other people were. We got massive attitude and told we could sit at the bar.  Way too much attitude. We left and went to Margaritaville where the staff was awesome.

wdkJIVBIcOxzefrH4g5Abw.text: This place is absolutely amazing! Not only do they have amazing food (please try the mole enchiladas) but they also have a bull you can ride!! The rooftop bar overlooks the LINQ and adds to the comfortable ambiance. Our waitress was attentive to our large party and chef Garry treated us to overwhelmingly delicious appetizers and churros! Will definitely be returning soon, thank you Chayo!

12cAfKD5rqLzxVOF2qsehA.text: This place has the worst customer service.  Management - you should wonder why?? This restaurant deserves zero stars for absolutely no respect for its customers. The hostess and servers look very unhappy as if they do not want to work, particularly the female server that is supposed to be serving our table. So we walked in, the restaurant on 6/25/19 at approx 1 pm. The restaurant does not even have 10 patrons. We asked to sit at at table by the door (right at the entrance to the inside of the restaurant). The hostess tried to put us at the next table but we chose this one which only needed to have a plate and a glass removed from it and which is still a table being served by the same waitress that would have been serving the next table.  We sat there for half more than half and the unhappy server keeps walking by, ignoring us and making faces as she passes by. Obviously she was not happy to be working there. The hostess keeps passing us up and down ignoring us. I called out to her and she ignored us. Past half hour later, I got up to enquire from the hostess why is it that we are being ignored when we are sitting right next to the table we were supposed to sit at and requested to speak with a manager. The response we got was that the manager could not change anything. How sad!! We walked out!!  You are in the business of hospitality...... think again!!  I will never recommend this restaurant to anyone. Customers, if you want to feel appreciated (since you, the customer is paying for service) go to another restaurant!!  This place does not deserve you! What horrible service!!

qWvEwIQ7EOsiQXAMUUfHdQ.text: We stumbled upon Chayo in the Linq while wandering the strip looking for breakfast on a recent trip. We thought about trying Hash House A Go Go, but the line to put in your name was 10 minutes long, so we checked out their menu and ended up here instead - and we were thrilled! I had the green scramble ($14, green chili pork, tomatillo sauce, spinach, jalapenos, guacamole and cheese), and it was REALLY good. So good, in fact, that I suggested going back the following morning to have it again!   All of our food was really good with the exception of one item - the chicken tinga skillet was SO salty my friend could only eat a little bit of it.   Our waitress was great, too - giving us thoughtful opinions of the menu and her recommendations - and even after her area was switched to a different part of the restaurant, she was on it and never left us hanging.   It was a great spot for a hearty, reasonably priced breakfast.

K5Xbu8L8sK98-1CyLjWHTA.text: 1st of all . IF I COULD PUT A NEGATIVE I WOULD ! This place is no good they burn you when you purchase a bucket of beers they give u only 4 beers..  there wannabe micheladas taste like shit .. the manager is an asshole ..no customer skills . $7 broken chips & guacamole when you ask them to change the chips due to the fact there all broken they say u have to pay extra! There customer service is very very horrible!!! They best need training a lot especial the manager who comes and just snatches stuff from your hand when all it was was beer salt like really dude!

qqVHhJCUtmMPp6dY5_Y2Tg.text: Drinks were amazeballs, food was good with big portions. I got the corn enchiladas . Bartenders were very generous with the tequila.  Shrimp burrito had so many shrimp in it.
