6r0WzkRN2RB7B7MYk1AYDg.text: Love this place.  Every time I come to Vegas this is a must stop for me.  Great Mexican food, great drinks and margaritas!!!!  Plus rom Groupon they have good deals for this place. But even without that they have a great happy hour!

Fke58K4emVAzQ_h7i9SCCA.text: This spot is spontaneous! Today, we got some chorizo nachos and they were amazing, our server was super nice and chill.  The place is neat too. Afterwards we rode the rooster for free! Totally coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8vp9CO17vZ68HaIZ1JW2RQ.text: Horrible place. we were there on New Years Eve for dinner and it wasn't even that busy and the waiter was so rude and short. Got mad because I didn't like the Margarita! then we asked for extra Tortillas 3 times and finally he came and threw it on the table. And then at the end basically threw the check on the table and walked away. Never saw him again! Then after about 2 hours of eating there my husband got really sick...cramping and nausea. The food made him sick! I called and asked to talk to the manager a few days later and left a message with Tammy and said she would have the main manager call me back - Greg Waters....of course NEVER heard from him. Pathetic service and attitude. WE WILL NEVER EAT THERE AGAIN! be careful eating there...it could make you sick!

8EAE-NhNG-ZaXoNj-jkKNQ.text: I reserved this restaurant for our company Christmas party 6 weeks in advance. The hostess toured us of the upstairs private party room and we reserved the room. There are 35 people in our party. The day before I decided to double check the room and confirm our final attendance number.  I was introduced to the manager who proceeded to tell me we could still come but they would not provide the private dining area. She had the nerve to tell me that the owner reserved it and we would be ok seated out in the Restaruant. No place for our musicians and no private sound system she basically said too bad deal with it.   Never again will I visit this Restaruant. I told our entire company about the terrible experience I had with this manager and we moved our party to Giada's who happily accepted us.

yWl9C2wb-7gGOvKeooua_Q.text: Was craving Mexican food while in town, stopped by here menu looked good and prices were decent so I sat down. Atmosphere is nice, I ordered chips and salsa and a Mexican chopped salad with grilled chicken and avocado dressing. The chips were seasoned and tasty a little spicy for my liking but ok. The salad comes and it is not  hat I expected just romaine lettuce with a few beans and pieces or corn and 3 slices of avocado and some grilled chicken. It was extremely spicy so spicy I couldn't bear to take more than a few bites. It just was not what I was expecting. I told the waiter it was too Spicy and that I couldn't eat it he offered to get me something else but I felt gross after the few bites I had he was understanding and even took it off the bill. Service was great our waiter was very sweet but i don't recommend the food if you're not into super spicy.

Mag_ORBLiuLxSmbPXWZkPw.text: Always get their chicken or steak fajitas and quesadilla , great mexican food and located right outside The Linq and Flamingo along with several other dining and shopping options .

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken quesadilla with beans and rice

eO_5Ykya00pBaIoVdJ5dlw.text: Thank you, Miranda for your great service. Food was great. Atmosphere is busy, quick service. Visiting from Salt Lake City, Utah. When we come back. I'll hit Chayo again!!

7bt0qqYZQeb_H4CZJsvJVw.text: Very good food there and great prices!!!!  I had twice breakfast there and so yummi (huge portions and very good salsas and music)

AY1BfxbB7UoJx3Yh9-EQBQ.text: If you like paying high prices for precooked food then this is the place for you. We went to Chayo for breakfast and the only thing that was not precooked was my eggs and toast. Even my husbands omelet was precooked the eggs where just folded around the filling. Also the photographer scammed us out of a photo. As we paid for 2 photos but only got 1.

Mwu7-jlIMcQHKOVKvJRAyQ.text: Very fun location as it's located on the Linq Promenade which is a stone paved street with stores and there's a patio for outdoor seating and people watching.  I went in for breakfast and ordered the breakfast burrito which was just ok.  It was a bit dry.  I also ordered a single pancake and that was delicious.  The fruit that came with it was fresh and tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. delicious pancake

BG_epWlQkVWy3sArXz7MdQ.text: Exceptional food!!   Last time we were it wasn't too good, but they've changed ownership! Very great food Fidel is a great waiter!! Will definitely recommend and will come back !!  (Night life is so much fun here! Careful with the BULL!)

2v43uMPoHmSYk5H6y924gQ.text: The food, drink and atmosphere is amazing. Ericka, my server last night was fantastic!!!

b_--m6aj4i_oGDWbIP1i7Q.text: Where do I start??  Me and my bf were debating at eating here or el segundo sol.. I wish we chose the latter because This place was disgusting. But we are all for trying new places given that we already ate at el segundo once.. Anyways back to Chayo.. As soon as we walk in there's insects on our table. I order nachos for us  i ask for everything except queso.. meaning I want lettuce, shredded cheese, pico de gallo, beans, and anything besides queso & meat. Then I went ahead and ordered green enchiladas minus the chicken. I don't eat meat. And my bf went ahead and ordered Fajitas. The nachos come out and it's just CHEESE AND a bed of LETTUCE!! The cheese is still cold and not even melted!! They were very stingy with the cheese too didn't even give Us a lot but it was fine. I just asked the server why we didn't get beans and pico he said I was just told cheese and lettuce... so I said can you bring me beans and pico?  He did. Since my bf doesn't like beans  I decided to eat it on my own with a fork and when I started eating it, I tasted   CHILI  from Wendy's.. DID I ORDER BEANS OR CHILI?? I didn't believe it but then I started to examine the beans and saw PIECES OF MEAT!!! Welcome to my worse nightmare.. i ask the server if the beans has meat and he said no. I didn't believe it so I showed my server  and she apologized and then informs me that the refried beans that comes with my enchiladas are made in pork lard and the rice has chicken stock! Why wasn't I told before?? When I ordered enchiladas without MEAT! Nachos without MEAT. Why would I want beans that has pieces of MEAT and my refried beans made with pork lard! Yuck. My bf also hated his fajitas and thought they tasted disgusting. Had to walk to sprinkles cupcakes for dessert cause I did not trust that place. Only giving it two stars cuz the server was nice and we had a great view at our seat and I liked the enchiladas I customized. If you're gonna eat here then at least sit Outside.

dWeX6PUygK9UM32kInE1qQ.text: We came here a year ago(May 2017), absolutely loved it! Shrimp tacos were delish, anyway , they don't have it anymore.   Restaurant had many open tables , host had us wait for 10-15 min.  Chips and salsa are ...just not fresh at all, salsa tasted like a tomato pasta sauce.  Appetizers plate is a waste !!! Quesadilla is cold and plain, chicken taquitos the same + they forgot my guac. Ugh, and it wasn't busy at all!!  Won't recommend it

nxcphRMVnykvxfSe7hWqyA.text: My boyfriend and I ate here last night, and it was so good! We ordered the chicken taquitos, which were amazing! For dinner he ordered one of the burritos and I had chicken enchiladas! Gary the chef Is wonderful he came out to check on us to make sure everything was good. Our waiter was also great, he was very attentive and personable. I apologize but I do not remember his name. I definitely would recommend this place.

jWK39Fx0P2N6grTRvEpqcA.text: Drinks, yes! Food, not so much.  White sangria was very refreshing.  Chicken tacos were bland.  Also you have to pay for the chips and salsa.  Service was so/so.  Wouldn't be back for food but would for drinks.

hHsaefGcDWzsIw5F3179Bw.text: I went this past Saturday night to Chayo (8/25) and Miranda was my server. BEST SERVICE EVER. I was extremely happy with the service my friend and I received. Miranda was super knowledgeable about her alcoholic beverages and food options and very friendly.. AND on top of it, the food was delicious. So props to the chefs too! Definitely recommend this place 100/100 Miranda is the best Server at Chayo hands down. When you come to Vegas, make sure to stop by the Linq Promenade, go to Chayo Mexican Kitchen, and do yourself a favor and ask for Miranda to be your server lol! Chayo Restaurant needs to give Miranda a raise Hahaha!! P.S. TRY THE CHICKEN TAQUITOS AS THE APP AND THE MOLE ENCHILADAS FOR ENTREE, YOU WONT REGRET IT!!!!

Wy5xFQ8Hp_GsuQkJaXfwxA.text: Happy hour is the shit $2 beer is that shit go here get fucked up and you'll have a good time in Vegas

rc3iwUIjlcJrgoawSOiwPA.text: If I can give this place a negative star I would The place was basically empty we sat down we didn't get our drinks till about 30 minutes later our waitress was extremely extremely rude food came out very cold manager was extremely rude!!! These people definitely need to step up their customer service food was awful not worth coming here better places around

LR-MuT1JPC3J68Hw0ll8Pw.text: Wonderful atmosphere, good food, great people watching.   We stopped by for drinks and were having an amazing night already, but it got even better thanks to our terrific server Christina. She kept the drinks flowing, was extremely personable and seemed like a wonderful person inside and out. We are already planning on coming back and seeing her. Seriously, one of the best times we had in Vegas.   Christina, if you are ever in NYC, you better come find us :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Christina is the best

GM20rNKM6HvaWtmH86N7AQ.text: Great customer service, so far the best I've had since arriving to Vegas. came here with my girlfriend to enjoy a nice meal and I have to say the food is amazing started off with the steak fries very delicious for entrees got the shrimp tacos and the carnitas burrito really good , the one thing I really like was that when we got there I was feeling a little bad so we didn't actually eat the restaurant we had to go back to our hotel and the manager notice all the food was still on the table he came to us to make everything was good with us really shows he cares about his customers definitely will be coming back

rISM8HysYbuc7qq7q3P7Cg.text: Playing tourist today, so a group of 5 of us headed down to the Linq for lunch. We were walking along the promenade deciding where to go when we spotted a brightly colored outdoor patio restaurant. We all love Mexican food so decided to give it a try.  We started off with the salsa, guacamole and chips. All were fresh and tasty. For my entree, I had the shrimp ceviche. Shrimp, fresh jalapeno, tomato, onion in lime juice, Delicious from the 1st to last bite. Other items ordered were the chipotle wings - a little heat and tasty, the chopped salad - great flavor and the carne asada burrito. So big, you may want to split it. The margaritas were tasty and the beer was cold. Our waitress was great checking on us often. No complaints. We all enjoyed it and were excited to find another Mexican restaurant in town that we liked. We thought the prices were reasonable too. As for people watching... sit on the patio, it doesn't get any better.

huzy7Sx_KI5EWjXGcr2tgA.text: I'll start by saying if it wasn't for the groupon I had purchased I would not have gone, nor returned again. The food was very decent, I had a large party of 18 and no one walked away loving their plate. What I can say if the coconut margarita was delicious! But when it came to paying the waiter never told us that we would not be able to split the checks! So being a retired waitress myself I broke it down for everyone and the waiter could not figure it out! Than he tells me we can only use 3 cards, which even though I was frustrated with I said fine. So I collected cash from everyone so we would specifically have 3 cards. Spent an hour there after dinner just trying to process payments because the waiter kept messing up. He had to bring me 4 different checks because again he kept messing up. Overall it was a very frustrating experience. My recommendation is that when customers call to reserve seating for larger parties than 8 you specifically tell them about your payment and splitting checks rules. This allows time for everyone to be prepared upon arrival! Not wait until after dinner to tell us. Considering I booked over a week in advance. Once we finally got out, a few days later my friend called me to tell me she had a $600 charge on her credit card from the restauraunt which was completely impossible because I paid the remaining balance at the end of $388 on my credit card! And lastly we asked to sing happy birthday for 2 people. The waiter brought out 2 desserts than charged us for both of them. Very very frustrating and unfortunately they will not receive business from neither myself or the remaining 17 in my party.

s6fa9Ok73lEoA0dH24jgLg.text: We are Mexican and know what a high end restaurant should be and the food must meet our high standards. My dish was fantastic (Diablo Shrimp) but my husbands was sent back twice because Salmon was very under cooked. Our server comp third plate because even he saw second dish was under cooked as well. Server (Nick) had the bright idea to ask cook to cook salmon sliced in half. Finally dish came back absolutely fantastic. Closed off with a flan and tasted just like back home. Service needs improvement because Nick seemed to be on his own working trying to meet everyone's needs. Drinks came late but yes food is great.

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

czGmhEtUakii0fjV2ADGWg.text: We went for a BDay celebration with 10 people on 2/11/18.  Brought a cake.  Was told there was a "cutting" charge, $5 a person.  What the what??  We had a serious discussion with the manager, eventually he saw things our way and waved that nasty fee.  Rough start....hence, only 4 stars. After that...Fabulous experience!  Lots of pampering from the waiters, a magician doing card tricks for the birthday girl at our table, the cake came out with candles lit and waiters singing!  The food was very good, can't say great because it wasn't hot.  BUT...4 stars earned with yummy cocktails, good food and truly exceptional service.

jKvuQQazm7QIFTc-8AaELQ.text: Food was delicious! I stayed as The Linq so was very convenient for breakfast. I had the Chayo Sunrise morning cocktail which was very delicious and the Chilaquiles as my entree. My friend and I sat outside under a heat lamp. Later they turned on the TV and it ended up being too loud to be able to speak so we left. Service was friendly and restaurant was clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles! So good!

nuDEmaZZGmPUnHz0J6LoUA.text: The food was decent. I asked for my lobster tacos to be grilled and it came over cooked and fried which i wasn't happy about but when you've been drinking all day being upset or sending it back wasn't an option anymore. I ate it and still was unpleased but thankfully my friends ordered steak tacos and i was happy about that.   The carne asada was peppered steak and the cheese was super yum. The end result my stomach was full and I was able to go in.   I also came the next day and ordered the 2 for 1 happy hour special and I got super crunk! Friday night was club night and sat night they had the fight and a mechanical Bull which looked fun!

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drinks!
Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shots (under the 2 for 1 special)

MARXJVuCVVSdxiJmBLSNGA.text: My family and I were pressed for time and was really hungry. We literally looked at the first empty restaurant and asked for a party of 11. I wish we looked in a different direction. When we told the hostess she just looked at me like I was a crazy person for asking for a table for 11. After staring at me for a bit, she said "ok." and walked away. I assumed that she was going to go look for a spot to put us, but then she never came back. We stood there for 10 minutes without anyone saying to us or helping us out. Then another woman came up to us and politely said, "have you been help?" She ended up seating us right away, which was really strange because that other girl just disappeared or just didn't want to help us.  Our server took our order pretty quickly and our food and drinks didn't take too long to come out either. However, once she dropped off the food, we never really saw her until she dropped off the plates. The restaurant was almost empty so I don't know what she was doing or where she went. We also didn't get any silverware with our food, so we were just waiting around for someone to drop it off for us. To top it off, when we did ask someone to help us, they responded with, "that's not my job." and another person said "I'm not allowed to bring food out." I have worked in a restaurant for over 5 years and this type of behavior baffles me.  The only redeeming things about this place were their margaritas, filet steak nachos, and chicken enchiladas. Those all tasted pretty good, but nothing special. However, my boyfriend ordered the Mexico city burrito and it was literally the smallest burrito I have ever seen in my life. For $18 we expected something either huge or extremely delicious, but it was neither.  Overall, horrible experience! I would have given it zero stars but the margaritas, nachos and enchiladas saved it.

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken enchiladas
Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margs for days!

FyiT6OkAWxO837YzP9Ct1w.text: After a hot 3 days of  EDC we were craving mexican food, and since Chayo Mexican Kitchen is located right next to the flamingo we decided to try it out.  Let's start by saying that the service was great and fast, but the food was a bit disappointing.   FOOD:  Filet Steak Nachos $19 :On the menu it said enough for two, but when it came out " MAN" it's big enough for 4 people. The flavor was great, but the filet steak was pain and wasn't season  or wasn't season enough!    Beer Battered Lobster Tacos  $19: I was disappointed with this dish. The presentation was nice and everything ,but the star of the dish the lobster was way over cook . It was super dry and chewy. The chipotle mayo they put on was very good tho.   Sorry Chayo I'm just not a fan yet !

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Steak Nachos! Huge enough for 4 people!
Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer Battered Lobster Tacos !

UBOfB_ukVDl7ZxmNyLujow.text: Visited this location and it seem like a nice place. Unfortunately the food is a lot left to be desired.  I ordered the salsa verde chicken enchiladas. The  flower tortillas were crunchy and salsa and chicken had absolutely no flavor. Side of rice crunchy as well and beans no flavor. My partner orders the asada tacos and meat was bland.. this is a place I will check off my list next time I visit Vegas.. with so many other good places to eat, this is not one of them.

qEOwuxuED5oy2AyQdZejLA.text: The food was good. The drinks were good. The prices were steep. It wasn't a surprise because restaurants on the Strip tend to be overpriced. But the service was terrible. Our server was a mumbler and never looked us in the eye so we didn't really know what he was saying or if he had heard us. We were there for an hour and got our waters refilled once and no body checked on us.  I do not recommend Chayo. The Strip is full of Mexican restaurants so it isn't hard to find another one. And the drinks you can get anywhere.

BgjR7x2N5Q-8L2HxTcc4Jg.text: food was alright but expensive. definitely a place for tourists. But if you are a tourist and looking for something to eat Mexican wise. this place may be right for you!

UeRWd3Eh5aObgs4JiJh-Uw.text: Christina was my waitress today and she was amazing! Food was great, service was great, tequila was amazing! Will come again and ask for Christina!

7-jDiAxnzxbBNbfdAC069Q.text: We went to chayo for breakfast. I had the breakfast burrito and my husband the chorizo tacos. Both were amazing and their salsa is wonderful. Chad C was our waiter and he was 5 stars as well!

xz0sdmJ4YE_m4-RW1FwgPA.text: I was expecting better service from this Mexican restaurant in the Linq we were seated outside - after 25 minutes i flagged down a bus boy to see if he could inform our server we were here.  Our server showed up a couple of minutes later only to inform us, he was "hanging out doing nothing on the otherside of the glass" I ordered fish tacos, without sauce 1 fried 2 grilled.  The 3 grilled fish tacos showed up, cold with sauce - no apology from the server or request to see if they should be remade.  He did ask if i wanted more cabbage to put on top.  The tableside guacamole was expensive for 1 and a half small avocados, and i had to request the remainder of the guacamole that was left in the serving bowl, be added to what was served.  I will not return - overpriced and bad service not a good combination

9sW563z7aiqR9sWXuLF_-g.text: Great prices on drinks. Chips and salsa on the house! Would highly recommend this place for reasonable drinking. The sangria was fabulous (white was the best). Excellent service.

7s6TnpQQ4LmyBfBI2rNbrA.text: A little pricy for the quality of food you are getting. We ordered Filet Steak Nachos as an appetizer. The nachos came out with just chips, cheese and the steak. Steak was great but the cheese literally tasted like the cheese you'd get out of gas station nachos. But service was good. The two stars is for it being pricy for what you are getting. No restrooms on ground floor. Uh..:just not feeling it.

gkb7wcSmc2x_4R38ixATWw.text: My sister in law was visiting from Colorado. Originally we were going to hash house but it was too busy. Went into Chayo not knowing what to expect. We had the Chilequiles to share and it was bomb. The food and service was amazing. Thank you Massih for the delicious recommendation and making it a great experience overall.

Q0PXpLDt_Bf3lLAUx2ushg.text: I'm going to give this four stars for value and a good experience.  We stopped by for breakfast and they were able to sit our party of 9 or so quickly.  There was a large computer issue that caused our food to be delayed, but the manager let us know and apologized for the delay and error (much appreciated).  The food was tasty priced very reasonably.

MVLa1RnKS0dl1zxuDV_BZQ.text: The food is authentic with high quality, nice service and a cool decor and ambiance. Of you like good quality authentic Mexican food, this is the only one on the strip. Exceeded expectations.

zWUurFaTQO5hXwMA5bchXQ.text: Just went here for lunch yesterday because hash house a go go had a 2 hour wait, the menu seemed interesting and our group of 4 wanted margs so we went. We arrived there at 12pm. After being told there was a 35min wait, we walked around and waited for the table to be ready. We walked back 30mins later and it was ready so that was nice. Though as we walked in and got seated we noticed that the restaurant was nearly empty. Why the wait we don't know. Our waiter seemed nice and got our drink order, we got our pitcher of margarita which tasted only like marg mix with no tequila. We got our margaritas at 1pm, it then took 40mins for the waiter to come back to take our order. We didn't get our food until 2:15. We shouldn't have waited over an hour and a half just to have our order taken. The food was good, very pricey as you may expect in Vegas. Overall terrible service awareness for a relatively empty restaurant and not a good experience. We should have just waited for hash house a go go.   TLDR; just go to hash house a go go.

TVJoROKqm7-5uedlTPThtg.text: Great Mexican joint away from the hustle and bustle of the strip. Enjoyed tacos, tostadas and guacamole!  Great service too!

7YjZVV9UQ9xOXbpKWcnbVQ.text: Taco Tuesday!! $3 tacos! All are tasty! Drinks are good too. Service was awesome!! They have plenty of TVs if you want to catch the playoffs and they have a mechanical bull!!!!

p97H7X30WbcMlD00KSZC3A.text: I went here twice today. Once for breakfast. I got the breakfast burrito and my friend got the huevos rancheros. Healthy portions and outstanding service. Our server frequented the table often and anticipated all of our needs. My burrito was mostly full of rice, but the flavor of their molcajete salsa adequately compensated. Dinner by comparison was a disappointment for me. We entered because the reception desk was empty. We were ushered back outside only to be quickly escorted back in. We were seated, but overlooked for several minutes. Our order was taken and drinks were brought to the table, then more than 15 minutes passed before we caught any of the servers' attention. They were gathered around the register. When we inquired about our chips with salsa and guacamole, only our chips and salsa were brought out. Then dinner was served and we again asked for the guacamole. My fish tacos were over cooked and dry. My friend ordered and raved about their butternut squash enchiladas, though.

J_YsR5GM5RjWVFnu-4HUnA.text: Ordered Steak Nachos and there was a lack of cheese. Our server was neglecting us, however, another server named Christina came to our rescue and completely rectified the problem. We got a new order of nachos and had a great time watching patrons ride the mechanical Cock! (Chicken)

eZSfo6A0l44Rw1x94EqOQQ.text: I have been in Vegas a few days now and just finished eating here for the second time. Had to come back before leaving for home. Great food, guacamole is incredible!  Service is excellent. Masih was a great server!!!

EO5i22r1Ynvy3K_d90J43g.text: Good fish tacos, not the best but very good. Loved the atmosphere, the service, and the upscale (but not too pretentious) menu. Good pick if you want more than just your average fare.

eVOq8EgfOhX6qb2qcWE6Tg.text: Found a deal on Groupon which apparently was relatively new.  It wasn't worded very clearly but our amazing server, Christina cleared things up for us.  We hesitated to even stick around after hearing of a lack of servers but once Christina knew we were in her section it was all good from there.    We even contacted a manager to tell them that Christina single handily saved our experience AND more so saved this place from a 1 star review.  Not only was she attentive but she was friendly and gave us her full attention and detail even though we knew she was rushing to make up for a lack of other servers.    Most come to reviews to only complain and that was likely going to be the case until Christina saved the day.  What an asset to this restaurant and to the management.  Ask for her by name if you check out this place in Vegas.  Entrances from both The Linq Casino as well as outside.

nq2rP1wKJnlalbV3_ITmwA.text: I am a law student at UNLV and every year we hold an event in the upstairs area of Chayo. This year we had already had one in January or February and wanted to have our annual one like always in September at Chayo. I spoke to the GM, Sean, and he  was extremely nice and said that the upstairs was being used more but he would work with us. I then spoke with Maggie the events coordinator who said something completely different than Sean and and we extremely rude. After weeks of attempting to plan an event at Chayo nobody ended up calling me back. They wanted us to pay $7500 for the upstairs and a $5000 minimum for an event we do every year without these requirements. Even if at the end of the day there was new management and we had to pay the least Chayo could do was return my phone calls or emails. Long story short... Chayo doesn't value local returning customers which is a lose of business for them. Because we would have had multiple events there and brought them business.

wSDD2BD_Ze2hskmZEtnDsg.text: We ate here when staying at the Flamingo, bc it's nearby and has patio seating. The tacos and chips and guacamole were all yummy. The prices for the portions were a bit high for home, but not too bad considering its Vegas. We were there early, too early for the mechanical bull, but I saw it on my way to the restroom. The place is really big, and I plan on going back at night to see what it's all about and to ride that bull!!

VxuioRN-WWf8Ii1L3iw9Rw.text: Excellent service! Christop (aka Christopher) is amazing, helpful, timely, funny! The food was great.. Definitely have a margarita.. Or two.  Ride the chicken... Ok I think it's a rooster.  We would definitely eat here again.

3HSeQ6AYiMhX42cYs1iC9w.text: I really enjoyed this restaurant though I thought it was strange that a Mexican restaurant didn't offer chips/salsa upon seating. Regardless, the food was delicious and quick. We had no wait at prime dinner time and the waiter was very pleasant. We ordered fajitas and tacos and both were pretty amazing. Other than that, everything was pleasant and enjoyable. A very nice ambiance indoor and outdoor option,  good music, clean, and great location with very decent prices.

SjRcqjl-jyykEudXYBWxrw.text: Chayo was so much fun this was our first stop and the food and drinks were great. The service was amazing, our waitress was attentive and quick! The manager Chris really made every effort to make sure we had everything we needed. Couldn't recommend more highly!

QXJZX0E685LZlUSEp0qZBA.text: All around bad experience. I had a Groupon and mentioned it right at the beginning. Also mention that we would probably want more food. The Groupon was for 2 margaritas and a taco platter for 2. The margaritas came and they tasted like straight juice. No alcohol at all in it. The taco platter came with meat in a ball on a plate beans rice and salsa. 3 tortillas were provided. I asked isn't this for 2 people. Are server just said yeah do you want more chips or something? So mad like I know we had a Groupon but don't treat us like trash. We were gunna order more food but we're gunna leave right after we get the bill. So disappointed.

_padxjneeE_F4-Z6lzyhag.text: The food was great; the service was great; the drinks were great. The only turn off I had was with security in the front having anti-gay comments about "gay" tourists walking by. As a gay client; I found this offensive that I had to hear their offensive jokes. I would give 5 stars but the security personnel comments left a bitter taste to my experience. This is 2016, there's too much hatred going on in this world and to hear these types of comments before getting seated is unacceptable for a business in Las Vegas. The gay community has over $800 billion in market share - it's about time to have a diversity come-to-Jesus meeting with these individuals making ignorant and low-class comments. Yelp is an app to evaluate services and not to evaluate prejudices against communities and individuals.

PNtoxrCLPANtL9RxT4L7tQ.text: They dropped 80% of our food and then tried a charge us extra for tortillas and sour cream. Portions are small. Food was tasty. I would try some other Mexican restaurant next time. Our amazing friends paid for our meal.

JXMcUhj9T36K9mERNKQPYQ.text: Seriously good food. The breakfast for two was jam packed with deliciousness. Mexican breakfast delights to please!  You will not hungry. You might be able to share among three people depending how much you eat. Coffee is good but gets cold quick. They need cafe de olla added to the menu.  Service was extremely catering, general manager sat us near TVs playing Jets game, he saw our Jets shirts .  He had a layout of TVs and what on...nice touch.  Walked us to our table and made sure we were okay or would have moved us. Music is diverse. Each song changes to a new genre, from Spanish to Billboard to Classic Rock. Wall decor and chandeliers are ethically chic.  We came for breakfast. TVs everywhere but it doesn't feel like a sports bar. They had a DJ station.  Definitely worth trying.  The couple from Brooklyn sitting near our table came back to eat today after eating here yesterday.

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cafecito
Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast for two

hu4GO8E7-IhZsXZTNsMhPA.text: I work in the linq promenade and I go to chayo all the time. I just have to say, this last time we sat at a table and we were served by christina. She is by far the most impressive and amazing waitress I've ever been served by. I'm a waitress myself, so I am a hard critic. She never wrote anything down!!!! She was  attentive,  and very entertaining.

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4hPq2vjajM36OeaWB5QKZQ.text: Well... Let me tell you about Christina. One of the most professional servers I've had in a long while.. Anticipated our needs before our needs even arose. One of the best serving experiences we've ever had. Will 100% come back as a result of her attentive service. Hire more people like her

ywLhLvr_5mPV_DZROIfi-w.text: This place is just alright. I mean, they kinda have a mechanical bull in the middle of the floor, so....  First off my friend and I came in and were seated in section that did not have many people. It took ten minutes before we decided to move to the bar, since no one came at all to help us yet. When we began to move, a number of people surrounded us asking for our order. Yeah, no. Bar time.  I got the Avocado salad which was pretty good considering it only had three small pieces of Avocado on it. It had spicy toasted pumpkin seeds, shredded cactus, and a very tart limey sauce. Not too bad.  Drinks were relatively priced, and having conversations with the bartender while he cut a thousand limes was fun.  Overall this was an ok place to go.

DWRatpjBXCsaWOn7arMeKw.text: Ok so this place has is pluses and minuses. To begin it is in a great location. It has an amazing view of the High Roller and the second floor has a great fireplace. They have an awesome bar and a mechanical bull. The night scene is decent for a restaraunt.   The service however is sub par. They are slow.... Very slow. Out breakfast which composed of a scramble and burrito took 45 minutes. I can only assume or ticket was lost.  Our sever ignored is Diring out wait and did not refill our tea once.  The scramble was good when it finally showed up, but not worth the wait.  Lunch a few days later was better. They had a shrimp app that was very good. The taco entre was average. The steak was way over cooked and dry.  They drinks were the highlight of the lunch. Which is to be expected I guess, after all it is a bar.

Pi8y9cogDzWmHWMUb9eF5Q.text: Food was ok. Shredded chicken instead of grilled chicken at a Mexican restaurant - no thanks. Service was horrible. Took about 10 minutes to get any service. Didn't check on us after we got our food. Asked for jalapenos, didn't get them. Won't come back. Many better options on the strip.

XhMVIWrwcJU5DKxQhjKRXw.text: I really enjoyed it here. Good Drinks and environment  If you like spanish music, they have latin nights on Fridays it gets good and its so fun. If you visit any other night they have latin music on the top area (terrace)

XzJVVbvRJ2pmRvPe78MhGw.text: This place is amazing! This is our second visit and we'll definitely be back. From start to finish the food and service is great, yummy salsa and chips to start, and the food is flavor packed. There's football games on multiple TVs on Sunday's and the atmosphere is  otherwise quiet, with downturned lights and pretty Mexican decor.

waHQ7KPrw-ZT2aa5fMadZw.text: The elote was good. Their food has flavor. I would go back. The yucca fries could be a bit more fried though. I think I'll ask them to fry them a bit longer next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster tacos, elote, yucca fries

3vG1rBZEzr_eTys1M9oUgg.text: 1 . The service was the nonexistent . We asked for lemon in our water and never got that. We ordered queso fundido as an appetizer and got it after we were done with our main meal and we had to ask our waitress for it. She never came by to follow up either we had to get her attention.  2.The food was so basic and not worth the money. Since the service was bad I was hoping the food made up for it .... Not the case at all.  There was nothing special about the food and it lacks flavor.   Unfortunately I wouldn't recommend to this place to anyone or go back.

QHVb8wAuSN3KICXt-h5nRw.text: Went here on St.Patricks day with my boyfriend. We sat on the top deck patio for margaritas and apps. Our server was amazing, we asked for recommendations and ordered that. What we received was amazing and more than enough food! The whole dining experience was amazing because he provided excellent service. I don't remember his name but he had tanned skin and longish curly hair. He made our visit unforgettable. This is now one of my favorite restaurants and it tell everybody to go try it!

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing !!!!!!

6aduSmg3wn0fKR79GQjLFQ.text: We saw this place the last time we were at the Linq & wanted to try it but never got around to it. This time we weren't very hungry but decided to stop in & give it a try. The atmosphere is nice and we were seated right away. Our server was Christina. She was amazing. She has a great personality, and you like her right off the bat. Very knowledgable, personable and friendly. I am a Customer Services Trainer and I am super critical about customer service. She was above the charts awesome! Thank you Christina!!!  We decided to share some tapas... Chicken gorditas, chorizo sopes & chips/guac. EVERYTHING was delicious! When I checked in on FB my cousin insisted we try the lobster tacos. We didn't get a chance to but we will definitely visit again. I really enjoyed the chorizo sopes! Great flavor and perfectly garnished!   My only disappointment...which is minor...is that they can make a michelada but not with the traditional clamato base. I would have had a few beers if they would've been able to offer a proper michelada. :(

s3YiRX-0dXUxs10xa4r06Q.text: First time here at The Linq and decided to check out Chayo. The table side guac made by Henry was phenomenal and he was very nice to ask if we wanted each ingredient before he mixed it in.  The chopped salad was huge and amazing and my friend had the Mahi Mahi tacos and loved them.  Our waitress Patty was just in a league of her own! She brought me a pitcher of Arnold Palmer because she saw how thirsty I was in this 107 degree heat and I couldn't be any happier! The place looks amazing as well and huge Tequila selection!  Also great mix of music!

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kZxbg6uaGYAh7I_IKUhE2w.text: Had dinner here last night, tortilla soup and chicken taco plate. Tortilla soup was pretty good, but chicken was dry, mediocre beans and rice, house Margaritas were $10 each and we're not that good. I have had better food at Pollo Loco. Try to skip this place if you come here they are on the LINQ Promenade. Also they were pretty expensive spent over $50.

qLj6Dr8RWtPDBjzBrteMxQ.text: If you are in the mood for fresh delicious Mexican food and great service run the other way!!!! If you are in the mood for store bought stale tortillas, margaritas full Of sugary sour mix and messy service this is your place! It's overpriced and the equivalent of airport food. My party and I were so disappointed. A few dishes we ordered never even made it to the table. The service matches the food quality. It's scary. This place is bad bad bad.

-srK5F3c8Ia-OG_uLgrvgA.text: Vegan only have to ask.. and then you'll get SERVED!! awesome fresh guacamole, salsa, crispy chips, and a veggie fajita platter (sin queso) that was great!! That, and a cerveza or two.. and you can enjoy a great meal from a fun place to see the action..

wrJ_BaT3SMK3sRBxUICDkg.text: Great decor, wide opened space which, I love and they even have a ride the bull.   The downfall is that the bathroom is upstairs, however if given the choice, I would definitely hangout upstairs, you get a bit of a view and it has a bar with plenty of seating.  As for the food, I can definitely say that I love the chips, love the green salsa but not a huge fan of the red salsa.  I ended up getting the pork ($26, not worth the price), which was okay, it didn't come with any but pork, which I was a bit disappointed with. I think I fort sick form it, because after dinner I did not feel well. I didn't drink any alcoholic beverage when I was there either and I was the only one that ate it.   My boyfriend got the lobster tacos, it consisted 80% veggies. The waiters messed up everyone's orders and have everyone flour tortillas and not corn (not a huge deal).   I did like the music they were playing a lot of "old" school hip hop.

OdRpHkA382NFy9_CG5HPvQ.text: I don't like to leave bad reviews, so much so that this is my first one.  I was looking for a late night meal and decided to check it out and therefore seated myself at the bar. A bartender leaving his shift informed that the other bartender at the bar would take over. After placing my order I never received help again. I motioned for the other bartender several times and was ignored each and every time. I could maybe understand if the bar was incredibly slammed and the bartender was all alone, but there were at the most 9 people at the bar who were mostly just drinking. After getting her attention, I politely asked for a manager. She disappeared for 5 minutes and told me my entire meal was covered. I sincerely appreciated that, but would've ordered more food and perhaps another drink if I only just had service. Finally I would've left a healthy tip.  Aside from the service, the food was slightly above average as were the drinks. Even if the service was excellent, I more than likely wouldn't have returned based on the food alone.

bq2tZ0BX5ruG62YpV8OwQg.text: My friend and I got the plate for 2, it was pretty darn big bc we didn't even finish it!!! Everthing tasted pretty good, got a margarita since it was my 21st. Don't know how margaritas are supposed to taste since this was my first but it had this awkward super super saltyness to it, I did finish it though. Waiter was nice :) 4 stars bc food wasn't super amazing, it was just good.

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plate for 2, was good :)
Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Left is the plate for 2

bzY0oaroMBWiJL8u0qytEg.text: The service here was not good and unprofessional.  One bar tender forgot our chips and salsa for literally 30 minutes after being reminded of it twice!  The other bartender was leaving so she asked if we could close out with her.  This was fine except we ordered happy hour two for one drinks and was still drinking our first one.  What's her solution...make the second drink and let the ice melt in it until we're ready for it.    Overall:  Bad Service.  Bad Experience  Recommendation:  Skip this place!

2KKYEuYzLQK6ead-_ZaGVg.text: So within the Linq next to an entrance to the Flamingo sits Chayo and certainly it was quite a fiesta..Now whether that's good or bad I guess the remainder will help determine?  It had almost a dive bar feel to me as it was a very small enclosure, but with it being NFL Sunday it did seem to house quite the mass of people..Atmosphere wise it was certainly popping, but a draw back for me was the street performers to the right from the flamingo charging pictures with a parrot..Can't say hearing those things squawk through the entire meal makes me feel like a high roller!  Foodwise I was sold on the lobster tacos..They came out in a quantity of 3 and more towards street taco size, but I did find them to be well worth it..The lobster itself came battered and fried which oddly enough worked for me and the tortilla itself did have a light feel to it and I wasn't left heavy as the meal concluded  Our server seemed a bit off though as his one liners were met with crickets and he didn't take too kindly to us not wanting to try the specials of the night..He wasn't quite his joking self when I passed on ordering the highly recommended chicken or steak burrito..It was almost as if I was in an abusive relationship and not allowed to order for myself when it came down to it   Overall I can look past a weird waiter and just say I would give this another go for a mexican craving walking around the Linq..Maybe next time I will not have to drive so that I can take in the alky and review that as well!

lLxjjrUeXRLjr4PErR3A7Q.text: So just now I barely get in this place and I get rude black lady hostess tells me sorry buddy no drinks allowed in here from casino. Then Chris the hostess tells me you don't bring drinks into apple Bree's a and I tell him it should not matter, all casinos in Vegas allows people to bring drinks into restaurants. He says because liquor license is different so we don't do that. Then I accidentally spill salsa on the menu and he says my kids can clean that up.   The hostess is rude and so is this waiter Chris. I'm never coming to this place again. I have not eat my food yet and I'm trying to calm down and see how it taste.   Not only that it's so loud in this restaurant and the casino you can't here people talk to you. You need to be drunk in order to put up with this place.   So this review is based on the workers. So far my chips and salsa are good and I hope my mahi tacos come out good, so in the end I did talk to the manager and told him what happened.   Sad thing is, the food is very good. But the servers and hostess are very rude.

E7g6TD3rAdE6S1yHvz9AqQ.text: Three stars was for the food.. Everything else was a problem. Couldn't get any chips seems like they pick and choose who gets chips and salsa or depending on the waiter... Lol...had the peach margarita taste more like sugar with salt and a HINT of peach. Once the food came it was delicious. The waiter was all over the place could of did much better. The place is nice

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. La persa
Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peach margarita

yQtcamOKi8ktw_jkWOhW9Q.text: My friends and I came to Las Vegas for a bachelorette party. We made reservations in advance and ate here the second night we were in town. We were seated right away. I ordered the chicken quesadilla and split it with a friend. The plates were very generous so I was glad we split an entree. We also ordered cheese dip ($12) for the table and although it took a while (and came with tortillas, not chips), it was still pretty good. My friends ordered a pitcher of margaritas and said they tasted great. The salsa was good and so were the nachos. The nachos were also very generous and plenty for one person. My only complaint was that we had to keep asking our waiter for drink refills. It was fairly busy though so I am assuming this is why he didn't come to our table as often as I would have liked. Overall, the food was really good and the prices were average. I would definitely come here again.

YHFgYmxgTCI49rL-Oa6nfQ.text: The five stars is for our server, Chad! We were in town for my bachelorette party and went to lunch here on Sunday. He made us laugh and smile throughout our entire lunch and seriously just made our day! Thank you Chad! :)

QXx5B_J_mV2PoW5f-lOzOQ.text: The food was mediocre at best. Too pricey. In and out burger in same area had much better food. Service was ok. Ambiance was nice sitting outside. Would not come back.

_IGaxB18GZmMliGVMxUj4w.text: A couple months back, I was in town for just a little and decided to give Chayo a try.  The food and drinks were pretty good but I have to say the highlight of the night was the resident magician.  Magic Mike made what would have been a normal uneventful evening into a memorable experience.  I will definitely be back to see him when I'm in town

d_ZaqY2ZiZkTLztWIUe4JA.text: Came for Saturday brunch, service was pretty slow , but food was very tasty , came back Tuesday for breakfast and service was much better .

VVloBNs-RhtsM_INoJvUHQ.text: Not a great start from the first minute with the hostess and then all the way through the experience.   Waitress was very nice and great personality but just did not have the skills to manage two large tables (us and another).  It took probably 30 minutes to get our drink order and chops and salsa to the table for example.  Each round of drinks took so long to the point where we were just "what's the point?"  When they finally served the meal, we ordered another round but the drinks did not get to us until we were nearly done.  Just poor service.  The food was just okay.  Not bad but not that great either.  As a manager myself,  I believe management is the core problem here.  Great location with a great visual appeal but staff looks overwhelmed and confused.  Saw no manager which is odd for not seeing on a large table.  And there was ours and another next to us.  Improvements in management needs to happen in my opinion.   Not planning on being back.

yltyPerVDRQ8ZuXZ6jEskg.text: Get the Sangria-  sit on the outside upper level for a great view.. (They added a fully stocked bar)... Order Lobster Fajitas (killer) & not on the menu!    Food great- service was great too!  Super attentive but allowed you to enjoy the meal... I'm coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Fajitas with the home brewed Sangria...!

jVw5_b6QufL8dH9BInmtbQ.text: Had the nachos.  It's probably me but the cheese sauce was "different". Not bad just different.  On the plus side the jalapenos were yummy and fresh

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nachos
Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh!
Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8qcJWS5fVMFgkf6yGAyuWQ.text: The chips and salsa are amazing. And I have had my fair share of chips and salsa in my time. The bar staff is great and take good care of you. I had a skinny marg  and a beer with my chips and had a nice chat with another patron and the bartender - the culture lends itself to that kind of experience. Love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ucst2fdW827C3TS5Xgx_pg.text: Food is mediocre. If you want GOOD or authentic  Mexican, go somewhere else. If you're craving Mexican while you're drinking & not too concerned about quality then have some margaritas & the food's probably good enough for that.

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken enchiladas, beans, rice &amp; pickled vegetables

zXeZwcJZO66ofAc3QOekQg.text: Got margaritas at happy hour and they were the worst margaritas we have ever had. Threw both of them away after drinking about a quarter of them.

8F779oMXhMAkoQxoZ8nO8Q.text: The food was really good , service was great . They were really nice . We ordered the lobster tacos & chicken nachos based on the recommendation of our server and the food was amazing . The nachos are huge , 2 woman barely put a dent in it couldn't definitely feed 3 easy . Must try !

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge Chicken Nachos
Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken nachos

xz4Gl8hMxlgn1KhWAf5x-Q.text: Money way stolen from a wallet  In the restaurant and manager was nothing but a piece of shit and got super defensive right away.

XKEDyDHP07s2NiDAgNYRkg.text: Terrible food and terrible service. Not worth the time of day.   It was not a busy night but our server couldn't be found.   I ordered The Don margarita and it did not taste good at all. It was supposed to be hand mixed (crafted) but way too heavy on mixer.

wKVJnDLLLwsdMaa4TDsxTg.text: Horrible service, waitress totally messed up our order twice... They brought us an appetizer we didn't order and we told the busser and he said don't worry about, so we start eating it. Waitress comes by takes it off our table and gives it to the right table, the one behind us and yes our chip is sticking out of the guacamole still because we were eating it... took us longer to wait for utensils to eat with then it took to get the wrong food... we never got napkins or an apology for all the mistakes ... We even went over our order with her 4 times and she still managed to royaly mess it up... We asked for a manager and she refused saying they are busy setting up downstairs for Latin night ... We ended up having to cancel our food because they just kept getting it wrong ... How hard is it to not put onions on tacos and to put the salsa and jalapenos on the side like the waitress said it would be??? Horrible horrible horrible, definitely not worth the price or wait?!!

78Ec0l-TClMzm7ArYluB2g.text: My friends and I visited Chayo on our final night in Vegas for our friend's bachelorette party and if I'm being totally honest, this was probably one of the worst dining experiences I have ever had.   Right when we walked up, we didn't get the best impression as the restaurant was pretty empty as we walked through to sit on the patio. Once we got out there, the music was absolutely blaring and we could hardly hear each other talk. We asked if it could be turned down just a tad and were immediately told no because it turns into a club at night. This was at 7:30pm...   Then, it took our waiter quite a few minutes to come up and the very first thing out of his mouth was "how do you want to do the checks"? We proceeded to ask if we could split it up and he took our orders accordingly. Fast forward to the end of the meal (30 minutes after we were finished eating), our waiter finally came over and said there were some items he could not split. Additionally, throughout the course of the meal, he really was not very friendly or attentive. To begin, our food was not great and one member at our table thought she was given something different than what she ordered and he basically dismissed her and just brought some sauce to cover it up. He also proceeded to yell at a lady who asked him a question at the table behind us and told her to "chill out and relax". He also told them that the food was out of his control once he put the order in.  We got pretty fed up, so decided to express our opinions to the manager on duty. He really didn't seem concerned about the situation or how the customers felt and sort of brushed it off saying "that's weird, he's one of our best waiters". While they did take 20% off our bill (which was nice), I unfortunately would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. We had some fabulous dining experiences during our stay in Vegas, but this was really really sub par. I definitely would not go back.

V43edZ_u4ySYcOJ_41hElg.text: Had a lot of fun here, although their nachos aren't as good as they used to be. But their desserts were delicious and there's ample seating inside. The servers were pretty friendly. I don't think I'll order nachos again, though. It used to be so much better.

BIXk43bVbI-bdBMwZ04kjw.text: My boyfriend and I came here on a Friday for lunch. We had passed by it the previous day and saw a happy hour sign and decided to go back the next day to take advantage however they do not have happy hour specials on Fridays. We didn't realize what day of the week it was! Nevertheless we were starving. We ordered the nachos with chicken which was a large portion. We each ordered a meal in addition which was unnecessary because I ended up taking it to go. I got the al pastor tacos which were alright. My boyfriend had a burrito which he said was mediocre. We weren't crazy about the food. The service was pretty good and it was a cool ambience inside. There's an upstairs too where people can go outside when it's nice out. My other complaint, which is a common one, was the price. Lunch was about $60 and we didn't order drinks. My boyfriend was so hungry and since we were on vacation we just decided to go there. I wonder how the drinks are. We probably should've kept it lighter that day and gone to in-n-out burger down the promenade for lunch. Can't go wrong for what you get and the price!

YKrrXeIuhgOhy25lZc17Iw.text: Sides my check in, I need to write a review. It's with huge regret too! I've throughly loved this place, I consider it home away from home for breakfast! Maybe hyped up for my usual chilaquiles, nevertheless sad to say the CHILAQUILES were quite distasteful, from the still very WET egg and no taste to chilaquiles dish itself. My waiter was kind throughout ot all just a shame really.

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chayo&#39;s is my FAVORITE! SADLY my eggs were VERY wet

3TOiePlvw9SCmDZe6obY4w.text: First, the food was good. The waitress was awful. We were told that the frozen drinks aren't worth ordering when we were seated. Okay. We order drinks and our food... and the drinks came. But the food did not... for 90 minutes in a mostly empty restaurant for lunch. Very disappointed. The manager was apologetic and compensated us, and the co-server was attentive, funny and charming. We just needed him to be the waiter... Might just be a disgruntled waitress who got put on day shift, may try it again.

a1H5FLRXaWnMOULlnBzc6w.text: We got the street corn, wings and fajitas. Street corn came with three pieces of corn. Only half the corn was covered in the sauce. Ate one and it was undercooked. The other two looked like it had rotten parts. Wings were good. The fajitas were cooked with tough stew meat steak. Zero flavor.

RTsaXukpAFyFz6uVdef-VA.text: Don't waste your time or money.  Service was slow, both from the bar and kitchen and the prices were extremely out of line for the meals served.  The four of us ordered different items, two were good, one was just okay, the fourth was sent back as it could not be consumed.  I ordered shrimp tacos a la carte but was charged the full price for the dinner plate.   Going next door to another restaurant next time.

_ayFeg1pyS6p_lciDVRO3Q.text: The food is good but the service is not that great. If you are a vegetarian, stay away from this place as they don't have anything vegetarian without any animal products. The food tastes flavorful otherwise.

zvQIPMZW33Pxx0g6UbOGSA.text: Massi took amazing care of us. Suggested great food and did not disappoint. He kept are drinks full and the laughs didn't stop.   Would recommend this place to anyone and ask for Massi!

UI0XvRGHz0dcldqPZOrAiw.text: Don't bother, food (pork carnitas came out in 7 minutes) is processed in batches, Flavor ok but worse the 3 tortillas were folded up in thirds and stuck in he middle of the beans and sauce so a total sloppy mess. The bartender said "it's how they do it in Mexico. WRONG!  Staff was nice but its twice the price it should be for a messy over crowded plate that is made in bulk.    Go across the plaza to Gordon Ramsey fish and chips!

sfO8R6UzVLnJU2JiAZR3YA.text: The food is not authentically Mexican food It's Americanized Mexican food They had a DJ playing some terrible Spanish music The waiter and waitress take a long time to bring you something if you need like salsa , cheese  Etc.  Some of the orders that we selected came with different amenities and I was really surprise with that   I was mostly disappointed with the service of the waiters and the waitress waited too long to bring you something you ask for  by that time we were already finished with our  food because we were so hungry and we wanted to eat  I will not be returning to this place to eat   I hope they can improve the waiter and waitress service

SEOvqCQRO1EIqdKosLaJSA.text: We went for the happy hour special which was a great deal, however the $2 beers are "mini beers" which is not advertised. The meals were relatively good for $5 price tag. Nothing special but for $5 Not bad. We went in a group of 7  and the server brought us one bill and then  seemed super flustered and annoyed  when we asked for separate bills. I would assume that in a group you typically assume bills are separate unless told otherwise. A good place for a cheap meal but you get what you pay for.

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak street tacos and nachos. Both $5 at happy hour.

eawWrHBZuSJvNZj_6Q5EFw.text: Passed by this location on a Friday night and heard the Spanish music playing, it was just what we were looking for. Our group decided to try it out thr next night and we loved it. The DJ had a wide variety of Spanish music from rock en espanol, to cumbia, bachata, reggaeton, corridos, etc. Glad to say we danced our night away.   The bartenders were really nice, the place was packed, and the atmosphere was good. They have a mechanical bull in the middle which gave funny entertainment for everyone there. The music goes on until 4am or 5am which is great.   We didn't get to sit down and have dinner but I plan on trying it on our next Vegas trip.   We can't wait to come back and visit Chayo's again.

W7DWPBOLqbwVVZoutcR5kw.text: Absolutely awful happy hour experience. Mystery upcharges, extra drinks being billed, overworked staff, and a very unpleasant atmosphere because of it.   I really disliked it. And so will you.

CYZTaWz4mdkJcIyes6nJ_g.text: My review is not for the food but for drinks and dancing. Drinks were pricey but we were there on a Friday night and the music was great so we just kept dancing! Fabulous vibe! Soo much fun.

cqCLqC0sjJSXw-9lbKEOfA.text: Located inside the Linq Promenade. Chayo Mexican Kitchen has options to sit inside or outside. Outside seating would be good for people watching.   They had a deal on Groupon which I snagged. $50 for $100 worth of food/drinks. Sounded like a good deal to me. I ordered a bunch of drinks and they were pretty strong!   The food tasted okay. I was not impressed by their rice and beans.   Service was okay as well. Not as quick or attentive, but enough to get the job done.

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ioMV386sPX-uFWIzuBu95Q.text: This Mexican restaurant located in the center of the link is amazing. It's upscale casual which makes it great for family or friends. Great service from our server Andrea! We had lunch here today for my 5 year olds bday. Adios!

jAQGvZvEEtYyeEfAyPqphg.text: Christina was amazing. Very attentive and personable. Her recommendations were spot on. One of the best servers I've had!

iud1XYZ3Xu7dRgez71yqIw.text: So good! Came here to happy hour for my bachelorette dinner and our server Christina was soooo good! So friendly! Food was so good too - lobster tacos and avocado empanadas!

kPDmkiy25wZ1U4MPCAZelQ.text: While the food was good, the customer service was abysmal.   I waited 20 minutes after being seated to get a glass of water, and I had to ask for it. When the waiter finally came over, he treated us as though my table was and imposition.

jMHOYjrxVcnRGs5OIC68ew.text: Very impressed. Fast service and delicious breakfast options. Family enjoyed the ham and cheese omelette, huevos rancheros and pancakes. Generous portions, filled  up with half an omelette. Coming from south Texas, Mexican cuisine pretty close to the real thing.

ijVfwVElJzmI9QRC6apvQg.text: Place is great for Latin night..food is great.  Upstairs bartender on friday night forgot his name, very arrogant fool.  Very bad service..very rare do i not leave a tip, but wow this guy was over the top rude. Talking crap about us to other waiters. This guy is in the wrong buisness,  I'm shure this guy will not have a job for long.

45Ae6g7HWlaNOiAbps6iQg.text: Our server Christina was AMAZING. She was so attentive. I asked for extra potatoes and she got them to me so quickly, like faster than the Flash. I was undecided about what to order, she recommended the Breakfast Burrito and it was awesome. I asked her for a Bloody Maria and she gave me all the different tequila options in a second. She knew her menu, she knew her drinks, she knew EVERYTHING. I needed coffee to go and she ran to get me a to-go cup for it. She was attentive, knowledgeable, fun, and made my breakfast super awesome. She was the best server I've ever had, ever, like ever ever. I would come back here just because her service was extraordinary.

Py-XF2buK9mrgc94tnpX1g.text: Ambience was good and its on strip ,Margarita was tasty.  Food was average for the price they have but its on strip so good area.  Overall it was average food and great ambience on strip.

Y9d10RQzjIk2UHZ-Mg6qFA.text: I've been to Vegas several times and never came to Chayo's..I decided to try this out today and the food was great!  More importantly the service from Christina was the best!  Her personality is very welcoming!  If you ever visit ask for her...service definitely made this visit worth it for me and my friends!  Planning to go back for sure....

2434-0i7aZypbh1TZqLroQ.text: Went in for breakfast and had Christina as a server. She was fantastic, sweet and very attentive. The serving sizes were huge and we all were very happy with the amount and quality of food. I would definitely come back to try lunch or dinner.

jdQq2I9RhuzsH6KU9k_7hw.text: After attending the Rise Lantern Festival my boyfriend and I decided to walk around the strip and we got a little hungry. So we came across this restaurant and got seated quickly. We got seated outside and our server came to our table pretty fast. He was very polite and was very attentive. The atmosphere is pretty chill, the had a mechanical bull that night I am not sure if they always do but it was funny watching people ride it. It wasn't packed at all, we arrived around 11pm. The only thing that was like okay? was that the dance floor was empty yet the music was REALLY loud. eventually they lowered the music. The food was good. A little pricey but its Vegas so everything is pricey lol

ri8u2JKYygTuFaE2J9OALA.text: Let's just say the food was great. Absolutely great. The service however was horrible. Worst I have ever had. I was with a group of 4. Ordered iced tea, got iced coffee. Food came out fast, but didn't not see our server for the remainder of the meal. Had to walk up to the manager and ask for check. Table next to us got up and walked out after not being greeted for 30 minutes. Sad that horrible service trumps great food. I know this better than anyone as a chef.

sGzmLEVhZ-p9ulocBBFpMQ.text: Ordered the butternut squash quesadillas! So bland, almost had to send it back. Just tortilla with foam type cheese on top. No flavor. No crunch. No beans, rice or anything else on the plate. Asked for salsa to throw on top so I can just throw the food down and get out of there. They charged $2.50 for the salsa! Had to get manager. He was nice, at least, and took the salsa charge off. One of the worst tourist traps I have ever been to!

FYsCw2A3-8HZGbdqalBhFQ.text: Friendly staff, clean place, large restaurant. large mechanical bull inside. We went on a Tuesday. On Tuesdays they have $3 tacos, the lobster tacos are $4. I got the lobster tacos grilled they were very good. They also have rice and beans free if you get 3 tacos. The service was quick too. Ill be back but only on Tuesdays, I think there are expensive for what they offer but it is located inside the linq. Locals wont pay $18 for 3 tacos and rice and beans

-E9Ngf5kedn3-nWGbLJuGA.text: We had our office Christmas party at Chayo's last Friday.  Everything was wonderful from our special menu to the personalized service.  I can't say enough about the great time we had.

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thank you Chef Saul!

jnbDtY7llTOZZLdwOw52gw.text: Wow, taco tuesday... plain and simple was hungry and needed to eat. BIG MISTAKE. Food was horrible, service was horrible, and did I mention the food was horrible. Plain and simple..go somewhere else we would never come back again.

TyH-vRhfO5ykU_bZt3NC4g.text: Great experience! I got the Para la Mesa which is a sliced new york strip steak, habenaro shrimp, and sliced marinated chicken breast fajita platter. So much food. The flavors were amazing and the heat was perfect for those who love spicy food. The portions were huge! I would definitely recommend this dish! The only reason i put a 4 instead of a five is because i felt the wait staff was extremely unattentive which was a little disappointing. All in all i had a great time.

rtEV6JALqP4Bx9pP9WRuIw.text: Super yummy food, great Mexican Mojito, and our server Christina was spectacular.  Extremely helpful and kind.

CToBPDeqonUwpW9aZFnl-A.text: Had great service from our waitress, Christina. She was very kind and provided us with great service making our time there so much more special. Thank you Christina!!

1S-FZtu-YbDq40UgrW0kkg.text: Had the delight of choosing this place for our first "meal" in Las Vegas... The guacamole was fabulous, nachos plentiful, drinks refreshing but the highlight was out attentive and friendly wait staff Christina, such a treasure!!!!!!  What a great place to sit and people watch too!

2yhLEUkoiwN-cdBgXAtEIQ.text: Waitress was very helpful accomodating my vegan diet, place was just a convenient stop but grateful to have met her and have been helped

whtDoa7GKN7_dSPFP3wMgQ.text: The margaritas here are very tasty! I also enjoyed their salads and enchiladas. The creamed corn is excellent. I highly recommend it!

Xw_GeWYOZowuXDStj1JApg.text: Happy Hour Mon-Thu 2-6pm  Happy Hour Specials: $2 beer, $5 margaritas, $5-6 select food items  Was in the area spending the day at the Go Pool.  Caught the end of happy hour.  Our bartender Chad was awesome.  Super friendly and outgoing.  Drinks were great.  We had several different flavored margaritas.  Food was ok.  Not bad.  Does the trick when you are drunk and hungry.  Plus it was pretty cheap.

uRf9WXtjchLWMmOLsmSt0w.text: Just ate dinner here on a whim and loved it! We wanted to go to Margaritaville but the restaurant was dead, so we decided to come here instead. There was barely a wait and we got a perfect table outside. Our waiter was named Fidel and he was amazing!! He recommended really great dishes and gave honest feedback about some of the dishes on the menu. It really helped us make a decision! I ordered the chicken fajitas, and my family ordered the al pastor tacos and carnitas tacos. Everyone really loved their dishes! This was an amazing find- so lively and delish!

rfW2fgQX64bAreH9q4GMAQ.text: Well, I never had such a bad Mexican food. Very expensive and unfriendly service. 4 of us came for a Girl night out. I loved the Music and the House Margarita's, but I don't think I will ever come back. My experience at this Restaurant was not even worthy of one Star.

NGfQMRaKPbYLgm3o6ERMNA.text: We came yesterday they didn't let us in because my cousin. I'd they  was kinda of not in perfect condontoon which is fine but today we came and got a table of 8 we were just going to order nothing but drinks but they told us we were aloud too only if we  had entres which they didn't tell us until we were finally at the table ready to eat and drink which is in mmm very upset they should have told us the Moment the moment we got to the table that's what any responsible table should have told us I Understand everyone orders drinks they should had told us the moment we got to the table but they told us 20 min after we got to the table and ordered the drinks I used to love chayoes but it's been worse and worse wouldn't. Recommend to anyone else:

8gOHrOujXI2qT_D_GNyDXg.text: I used to really like Chayo, it was one of my Go To spots to bring out of town friends while at the Linq. Great people watching, tasty food and creative fresh cocktails. I do love their fresh chips and salsas, the Baja style shrimp cocktail and tuna appetizer were on point! But I really do miss the Lobster!  Used to be one of the few places you could get lobster fajitas.  But the service we received today left a bad taste with me.   The place wasn't full at 3:30pm Friday on Memorial Day weekend and we were seated immediately with our choice of a table. It seemed adequately staffed but our waitress seemed to give better service to tables on either side leaving us unattended and without our drinks.  I had listened to the table next to us place their drink order after ours, but they received their pitcher of sangria and cocktails well before ours.   Roxy was taking an other order at the table on the other side when all our food arrived. I flagged her down and asked about our pitcher of Sangria and she said the bar was busy "Sweetie". But yet my water glass remained empty and our full food order before us. From her tone I was to understand this and wait?  But this didn't bother me as much as the way she addressed me. "Sweetie" "Honey" it just didn't sit well with me and felt condescending and disrespectful.   I was a big fan, now I have a sour taste in my mouth.  I just don't think any woman should be addressed as sweetie or honey. Unless we are in the south, even then I think ma'am would be more appropriate.   Sadly, I'm not sweet on Chayo and it is currently off my go to list.  However, bring back the lobster and I might be willing to put up with being addressed as  sweetie :)

Rmx4yZO-lgrzAwP57jt7Bg.text: I have been to this restaurant two or three times in the last couple of years. Their blanco margaritas are awesome! We love that it is tucked away from the entire strip, but that it is in the back ally between hotels that you can walk and get ice cream or other treats.   The service is good, we had a larger party that they accommodated. The space can hold people upstairs too.

GMycIL30NrRya30KOgHLKw.text: Pretty disappointed, worse than the last time I was here. Ordered guac which was one avocado worth and came with 10 tortilla chips for $15. Waitress was super nice and brought out an extra basket of chips without us asking (the only reason I give 2 stars instead of 1 is because of her quick and considerate service). Ordered beef tacos and it was awful -beef underseasoned, tortillas were stale, and beans felt out of an aluminum can. Worst of all, the two of us both had terrible stomach aches with bloating and gas for hours after that, and it really ruined our day. What a colossal waste of money and just a horrible meal overall. At the very least I expect things to be fresh on the strip due to all the traffic. Highly discourage. Will not visit again on my next trip (I stay at the linq often so that's a bummer since convenient).

DEDLMLkbnlsJ8Xwk0W9RJA.text: Service was interesting... slow but then really attentive. All the food was literally incredible. The chilaquiles had incredible flavour and everyone else was very happy with their meals as well. Everything was perfectly cooked and very fast coming out

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled chicken sandwich. Amazing. Great fries too
Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nachos!! No meat.

g7OWMjbJzAYOcEsYQMsKiQ.text: Came here for breakfast brunch and was immediately seated as the place was not busy. The restaurant is spacious, clean, and I like the decor. We were seated in a nice large booth.   I highly recommend you get the Groupon...it made this place more worth it. I would have been very disappointed if I paid full price. We both ordered the short rib machaca omelette. The beef was very flavorful and good...however it was very dry. The omelette/eggs was very dry. I'm not a fan of bell peppers so they were nice to substitute mushrooms without an extra charge.  The potatoes on the side were extra crispy like I like...however tasted like they were made from frozen and did not taste fresh. The English muffin was also a bit hard and chewy. The jams they provided were good. I liked the strawberry.   Our waitress had to wait on all the tables by herself. She definitely could have used some help. We had to ask for water, milk for our coffee, and butter for our English muffins. I would come back but only if I had a Groupon because there are better places to eat at the price they charge.

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib machaca omelette with potatoes
Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast menu

7jMEMw77ISUEaawPa_yVPg.text: Greeted by extremely friendly and attentive waitresses.  Got the nachos and they were very good.  BEER CHEESE sauce, c'mon!    Also like the ambiance a lot.

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

beiyVRT_TKnUI7JvQt01JA.text: We celebrated Cinco de Mayo here and it was a blast with my friends. Love Mexican food. We had Shrimp stuffed Chile relleno, chicken burrito, shrimp ceviche and loaded chicken nachos. We stuffed our bellies and drank razzmatazz margaritas. All of our food was delicious! It's located just outside the Linq hotel in the promenade area. The service was excellent by our 2 waitresses. They accommodated all of our needs even though it was a busy day. We sat upstairs. We will definitely go there again.
