ptcJNFFuzvnG2z8BYw92KQ.text: Went here for brunch while at a friend's bachelorette party. We had reservations and when we got there they already had our table ready and sat is almost instantly which was awesome. The food was delicious and the portions were massive so it was worth the price we paid for. Their berry pancake was amazing. Their salsa was spicy so if you like spicy stuff, you'll love their salsa.  For my drink I got a Bloody Mary and it really hit the spot. Not only was it physically appealing but the balance of spice, salt and liquor was perfect. I would advice them to give people the drink without the straw as the rim is dipped in spices and it absolutely heightens the taste of all spices. Probably the best Bloody Mary I've had in a long time.  Our server was nice but he was not efficient at all. Usually servers will take everyone's drink before moving on to the next table. Our server was nice but he literally had to come back asking for drink orders 3 times. He kept saying he forgot. It took about an hour to get our drinks. And then a half hour for our meals. Longest wait for drinks and food that I've ever experienced.  It wasn't all bad other than the slow delivery of drinks and food. If they can fix that then everything will follow suit!

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

te6KQfwF0QJiskkN0rvuZQ.text: The food tasted good but the service was not that great. Honestly, it was an extremely average experience. I asked to put some of the sauces inside of the burrito as opposed to on top, the waiter said they couldn't do that but they let me have them on the side and that they can do which made no sense to me. Prices were ok.

prPZvI2CxnzHu4afO_NeAA.text: Horrible service.  Waited for over 45 minutes for our check and we asked several times.  The music was way too loud to have a conversation.

GqTdPfv42UbpZg6UPJ--8A.text: This place is more "White Washed" Mexican food than authentic.  The inside of the place looked nice, but again not authentic. Skulls decorate one side of the wall and crosses decorate the other.   The service was also slow. We were a party of 9, so that might have been part of the reason.   Everything here is expensive or/and not worth the price. I paid $7 for a glass of orange juice. I wasn't really hungry so I got the tortilla soup. I think it was about $9.   The tortilla soup was okay. It tasted more like menudo without the meat.   One of the parts that does suck is that this place is one of the few on the strip that charge an CNF fee. The fee was about $1 a person.   Also what I didn't understand was that this place has a mechanical bull, but charges $10 a person if you want to ride it. Why not just make it free with a food purchase? It would make the place more lively.   I gave this place two stars for its cleanliness, location, and because the food was okay.

OUUZJCWj6quJcryll1Ljaw.text: Amazing service by Christina and Hillary was fantastic! Will definitely be visiting next time I'm in Vegas!

z71cRRCCYD0mgaP00xYPtA.text: Very good food and great place bring the family. Definitely recommend you try for your self

b3GiaAGd-l_5GVUJdqcqJA.text: Great food. Great service.  The food was delicious. We asked to be seated outside, and though the server had left already, they were fine with us sitting outside. The food was great, too. Lots of flavor and good size portions.

F6ZgSdUP46BEe4KI-ybPjA.text: While walking around looking for a breakfast place we decided on Chayo.  The chili infused tequila bloody maria was delicious although I enjoy more traditional garnishes.  The spicy pickled cauliflower and carrots weren't my favorite.    The carne asada skillet was good.  The steak was very flavorful but a little over cooked.  The molcajete red sauce wasn't noticeable on the plate and I was excited about this because I love molcajete bowls in Mexico.  We were a bit disappointed so we asked for a side of it to add and they brought us a salsa that just wasn't quite right for me.  The sauce in the molcajete bowls I've had in Mexico were just different than a standard salsa.

jvIHad7Z5WqwmimmJ-JP-g.text: Christina was the best server I have ever had! She hooked us up and was so kind, patient, helpful, and happy! I plan on coming here every time I'm in Vegas! Thank Christina!!! Great food, even better servers!

8NWDBHBML2suxI9ICvN0oA.text: This was the worst service I have ever had. To begin, the waitress came to our table, without introducing herself and said "what do you want?" After placing a food order she never inquired about drinks. The hostess was nice enough to get us water and we got up and ordered drinks at the bar. Another waiter proceeded to bring us food we did not order to realize it was for the table next to us. Our food was delivered, not once were we asked how it was or if we would like more to drink. The food was nothing to rave about. Do not waste your time or money. There are plenty of better places in Vegas to eat with far better service.

vnv41YfsROiYNXcgyQzQHg.text: Only 4 stars since i ate here just once.  Great breakfast burrito, great service and very reasonably priced!

p8Xd1cCf3gsgWxu9XLI6IQ.text: The carne asada and marg was great. Best part was our waitress Christina. She's got a great personality and super attentive. Top notch.

74x7ycnNV5LAc-cH2AF1mw.text: Not at all impressed. Food was pretty good but service was horrible. Sat for over 10 minutes waiting for just our menus. Once we got our menus we immediately  Ordered 3 beers. Unfortunately the 3 beers took another 15 minutes to get. Once we got our beers we finally got to order. This was of course not a quick process either. When we got our food, we asked for ranch and ketchup..... nothing. Asked a 2nd time..... nothing. Asked another waiter, was promised it would come..... nope! Tried to order another beer, the waitress forgot to grab them from the bar. By the time they were brought over we were literally taking our last bites. I'd like to give them the excuse of being busy cause they were on the strip but that certainly want the case. To say our experience was lacking would be an understatement. The restaurant is in a great location on the strip. The place was very clean. Sadly they just had bad enough service that I wouldn't consider returning

v9Sff1wwjU_2q5ZLlVlgPw.text: Would have liked to have tasted food.  But after 10 minutes in our booth with no service , we left.  Lots of staff standing around looking bored.

J_kc6cHnOXN7TlEaX4gGHw.text: Dissatisfied with food and service.  The food was bland and tasteless,  service was slow and I had to ask 3 times for a refill on drinks

HwvcHOZ4aU6fcn64N3Kaxw.text: Expensive. Paying for the location. Chicken tacos were average and the portion was a bit small. Wife had veggie sweet corn enchiladas. It was average again. Small portion again for the price. I ordered a margarita and it was good, but in a all glass for $14.

DnnU-sY8XBAyooMQRN2u9w.text: Great drinks. Very good food. Excellent service. Great place to watch a game and enjoy Mexican food.

o2Rta_Xw-XcXjsMwWHWzaw.text: awesome service,had an awesome experience from beginning to end.made sure we were taken care of.had a fun time all the while great food and drinks.Christina was frecken awesome.

MC-XpAkRqmW_ruw5bFCuow.text: The service was absolutely HORRIBLE! My friend and I went there for drinks and dancing on their Latin night. As we walked up, the guy at the door stared at us for a minute, so we pulled our IDs out of our purse. He didn't even look at them, he simply asked if we were going to sit and eat or just get drinks. We said we were going to just have a few drinks, and he said, "Ok, just go in." We had seen on 2 different websites, one being their own, that they had a happy hour/drink specials on Friday and Saturday nights, so we asked the girl behind the bar what those were. She was only on her 2nd night of working there, so she went to ask a "manager." He told her there weren't any specials. We asked to speak with him, so he came over with an attitude and proceeded to be extremely rude in telling us he'd do 2-for-1 margaritas since we were showing him the advertisement, but that they've never had specials on Friday night. We showed him the 2nd ad and he rolled his eyes and said, "What did I just tell you?!" He then said we'd have to ask a manager about the ads...the girl had told us he was the bar manager. Then a few minutes later a security guy comes over and rudely tells my friend and I that we "have to get off the chairs" at the bar because he was going to take them upstairs. The only nice people there were the guy running the mechanical bull and the girl who had just started working there. The music was good. The drinks were gross. I doubt we'll ever go there again.

ug8D3T6NZdaBVKD4eQfNGg.text: Went to Chayo earlier today with a group of friends looking for a quick bite. Loved the decor and ambiance, the food and drinks were yummy as well. What really stood out to me however, was the service. Christina was our waitress and she was amazing! Really fun, full of energy and immediately made us feel welcome. Come to think of it, the entire staff was extremely accommodating; the hostesses didn't even hesitate to pull together multiple tables for a walk-in party of seven. I will definitely recommend this restaurant to any of my friends visiting Las Vegas in the future!

dv75qTZXm2Aw7zaXOUTrzg.text: Besides the great food and drinks what really made our experience was our server Christina! The best attitude, funny and so eccentric! We will come back tonight hoping she is here! Thank you for our great experience Christina!

QdCPo-b96D7MUjgPDU4gpA.text: Ask for a certain drink and got told they didn't have it until my husband went to the bar and asked to be told of course they have the drink I wanted! The server forgot the water and when my husbands margarita arrived, no salt and couldn't get the servers attention so had to go to the bar himself to get it sorted. For a Mexican place, the margarita was sub standard at best. At this point we wanted to walk out but as we'd ordered decided not to. When our meal arrived and our server had put the wrong order in for us it was time to leave and never return!

cyEGhntACIR4nPraS3PAOw.text: Kyle did the best job, he is amazing best service all time in Vegas.  Thanks Kyle for making our night/trip!!

pSht9tHJt3pZB1E_UxHLpw.text: Took my son for his 21st Birthday..probably the most disappointing meal we had the entire stay in Vegas..Drinks were expensive and horrible..the chips were  stale and the food tasted like it was a frozen meal..also the music was so loud we could not even hear each other talk..everyone around us was complaining about the volume so they finally turned it down and about 30 min later they blasted it again..Im all in for playing music  but this was obnoxious with how loud the music was...the waiter even said it was way too loud and was literally shouting across the table..Paid a lot of money for this meal and was not impressed at all..would not go back when in town..

sCirIL2MlISNr_-RfDHcYg.text: A good friend of mine told me about this place so I had to try it. I ordered the beef short rib, and a lobster tacos to table share. The short rib beef was very tender and flavorful and the tacos were amazing. We also had a guacamole and chips and salsa for the table. The chips and salsa were unbelievable and the guacamole was one of my favorites ever.   As far as drinks go, I went with the servers recommendation and I must say... it did not disappoint. I enjoyed what they called the office, patron silver accompanied by lemon, cucumber soda and st germain.  Overall this was a very pleasant experience. The food was great and our server Jordan was incredibly helpful and nice. I would 100% reccommend this to anybody in the area looking for Mexican food.

SmuS4okZjbbyK9iU-TwvDw.text: Food was good, service was ok,it was slow on a Fri. but noticed the some of the staff had no training, and acted like they didn't want to be there, I'm a local resident so I'm sure the tourist think we have this all over. TRAIN YOUR STAFF!!! Our server was pleasant,and fast,but the rest forget it!! MARGARITAS were BAD!! for 14$ each.

oCzzvnQrvg-E00APKETNyQ.text: Christina is awesome! She is so professional and polite. Not only did she secure my order correctly, she made us laugh, we enjoyed her so much. #blacklivesmatter :) (insider)

dSZSvJ1_qpAcdCe8J_12Fg.text: The lobster tacos were incredible and we had the most amazing service from Christina!

yw8J_fLX-807MV6nyV9ATA.text: Where do I start the service here is fantastic ..the bar staff is amazing . They all know their drinks . Had a great time with them all on 3-31-18 cam3 in at 1125 am and had the best time.  Bartender randy was amazing absoutly loved him.  His bar back was busying his ass as well  randy would  tell you his name  Grest young man  Josh is a great bar back busting his ass . Love the whole crew .  Randy was outstanding.

lpJ-f6yGhOemxIqKcwTRjg.text: We desperately wanted to like this place, as the food cart outside is absolutely delicious. That being said, it's worth the visit inside if you're looking for a bar with a reasonably sized crowd and you want to dance. If you're interested in a meal, skip the place. My boyfriend and I could not hear each other over the ear-splitting music. Plus, the street corn served inside the restaurant was only seasoned on 1/4 of the cob. At the food cart, the cob was seasoned entirely. What gives? Skip the restaurant, get the food from the cart.

in0xJkh5sRni9-7BBdqb3w.text: I came here the other night because we stayed at the linq and tried the Asada fries. They're we're amazing but unfortunately we found a fruit sticker tag on them. The service was still good and the manager treated us right. We came again the following night because the food was so good. Our server's name was Ivan. Ivan is the greatest server you could have at this restaurant, he treated us like we were part of his family. The drinks and food came out promptly. We've never had this service this good before in Vegas. We ordered dHuevos rancheros, breakfast burrito and bottomless mimosas. Tryst me Ivan made sure we were attended 100% of the time. He never missed a beat and was on point the entire time. Ivan honestly deserves a raise for raise because of his customer service and constant cone day. He is the best server to have at this restaurant hands down. If you don't stay at the linq I recommend to come down to chayo for lunch or breakfast and ask for Ivan and I guarantee that you won't be disappointed. Thank you Ivan for the slaughter and the service and hopefully we run into you again.

yOgScrdfVGu_SQ8wRucH6A.text: It's just not good. Plain and simple. Overpriced- had carne asana burrito and it tasted sour like the meat was bad. I realize it doesn't come with sides, but why is the burrito served in a small lasagna boat? Makes cutting it extremely hard. My margarita was weak. I wish I would have went to chipotle. Would have been better quality (that's saying something...) and less than half the price. Sooo many places to eat in Vegas. Why bother with subpar expensive food?    Fool me once Chayo, but I won't get fooled again.

9jfHDeP2-x-hm2sJucjYMQ.text: Servers seemed a bit confused. We got someone else's appetizer and I guess they got ours. Asked about 7 times for some hot sauce with our food and it never got to the table. Food was good - not outstanding but not bad

YhjbEJUo9FpinhReeS2dZA.text: We eat Mexican food on Sundays, no matter where we are! It's great hangover food for me, we walked by this nicely decorated colorful restaurant and bar after our High Roller ride, decided to give it a try, we were hungry and buzzed, nothing better than some mexican food for us at the moment!  Chose a big booth to sit down comfortably, had guacamole, chips and salsa to start, very fresh and flavorful guacamole with pomegranate seeds in it, so good, loved the spicy and salty red salsa sauce! The chips were lightly seasoned, very crispy and yummy, they didn't fill me up too much at all.  I had shrimp diablo, the shrimps were so tender in juicy flavorful sauce, very delicious! Hubby had steak fajita in medium rare, he loved the tender steak with red in the middle, it was bomb! I liked the street taco sized tortillas.   Our food was great, I had a Chayo paloma, very strong and tasty. Our waitress was so attentive and fast, impressive service!    Loved our casual Mexican dinner, relaxing and chill vibe at this restaurant was just what we needed on a Sunday night!

kx8NpUcGZPnxxB_pfuTYTg.text: CHRISTINA WAS THE BEST SERVER EVER!!! TOTALLY TURNED OUR MOODS AROUND. The best part of the Linq so far was the service here at this bar. She was funny, entertaining and attentive.  Thank you!!!!  $40 for a pitcher of margarita, nachos, guava and chips and a quesadilla. All worth it.

Zlrn9xh8LAhUonAAkBXgBA.text: The employee named after our local legend Vicente Fernandez (Vicente ) gave us great customer service. And the food was really great and really like how they decorated the restaurant.

jRXYlV9A01POf5lRSMV1_A.text: OK so I have had their chips and guacamole there it's really good other than that I go here mainly because there's not a lot of places that play Spanish music around here and this is a really cool bar right next to the link up until now I didn't even know they had a ball but I have been coming here it's a lot of fun everybody that I bring enjoys it everybody's really cool down to earth and just has a good time.come here on fridays and Saturdays after 10pm gets more people

e_xPZtk8TYQ80vwr1NyXQg.text: I went to Chayo for my birthday Dinner and Christina was absolutely phenomenal! She helped us from start to finish and made our visit to Chayo a great visit by adding charisma and witty comments to our orders.   If anyone is wanting to have a fantastic dinner close to everything please go to Chayo and enjoy not only a great meal, but personalized service!   Thank you Christina for the amazing service!

TvB6D1xNup5xAQq_WXKFMw.text: This restaurant never disappoints!! We've eaten breakfast here (excellent bacon, and cooked properly, not burned to a crisp!) and dinner, also (the best shrimp tacos, EVER!). The staff is friendly and the service efficient! Only complaint, the bathrooms are upstairs!!! Try Chayo, you will be glad you did!!!! Prices within reason also.

NzgiUeUboZR98BqDaBj6Hg.text: Overpriced strip food. Food was OK service was horrible. If you live in Las Vegas save your money there are many other Mexican restaurants to choose from. I have never been to a Mexican restaurant that charged you for chips and salsa $4.95.

v-MynHiQ1YXgJaFzzZCj8g.text: I would highly recommend this restaurant!  Bartenders Ben and JD are the ultimate mixologists!  Very knowledgeable and can mix killer margaritas!  Love the attention to detail and the customer service!  My wife and I will be back!!  R and P Fuller

-3tl0tJoYEK8Ij2d34Uf8A.text: The staff here is friendly.  The decor is very nice.  That's what the two stars are for.  Otherwise, this was one of the most miserable dining experiences I've ever had.  I was there as part of a large group (40 people) and I have to say they really shouldn't be offering service for large parties because they can't handle it.  We had a fixed menu (which is fine) but even that was kind of a challenge.  Food problems:  We started with a Caesar salad and soup. The salad was warm because it had been sitting there for so long and the soup was lukewarm.  That was followed by a couple of tacos which actually weren't bad.  I made the mistake of getting the chicken for my entree.  It looked fully cooked, but the texture and taste made it seem underdone.  Nobody at my table who had the chicken finished it.  I did snag some yucca fries and those were good.  Additionally, it took a lot of time between courses.  Drink problems:  Even though we had 40 people at our table upstairs, there wasn't a bartender for us.  Any drink orders had to be fulfilled downstairs so it was a 20 minute wait for drinks.  They did keep the water filled.  The worst thing was that I was seated directly under a bright light.  It was incredibly hot and shining directly on me and another person and our table companions joked that we would definitely confess to multiple crimes before the end of the meal.  The staff was nice and they checked twice to see if it could be turned down at all, but no dice.  Apparently, there's no way to dim a light at Chayo.    Two and a half hours later, I just wanted to get out of there and I didn't care that dessert hadn't been served.  People were getting up and walking away from the table because it was so excruciating sitting there.  Spending that much of time, sweating like a pig because I'm baking under a heat lamp, waiting forever for a drink and eating warm salad and soft chicken does not equal a favorable dining experience for me.  Like I said, the service was friendly but for a large group, this place is an epic fail.

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unfortunately they have no control over the blinding heatlamps that make your dining experience miserable.
Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm salad and lukewarm soup...a losing combination.

UMEKWrzYbOsdF6Fx1Akezw.text: This place was absolutely amazing.   Service. Food. Atmosphere.   We came in around 4 pm and our party of four were seated immediately. Our waitress (I believe her name was Christina) was awesome. She suggested this "all natural" drink.. Can't remember the name but it was delicious and super strong because I was lightheaded half way through, Vegas baby.   We shared the chicken nachos and I had the steak tacos ($18) that were probably the best I've ever had, which is a bold statement.   Plus they take really great high quality pictures of your party at dinner and put them in these cute little frames and sell them to you. $30 for two (one of the 4 of us and one of me and bae.)   I can't wait to come back. Next time I'm gonna give the big ol chicken a ride.

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful plate. Had to practice some self restraint to stop eating and snap a photo. Lolz.

MXx3PRUmTs2sNK4tr_KmzQ.text: Nice Americanized taco stand. The taste of the tacos were actually good. The only bad thing was no tables to sit at we had to stand around. The line was quick and they had corn as well! Definitely recommend this to someone looking for a late place to eat quick.

txOFL6pKO2KHkPNCMU81GA.text: This is relatively new, at least to us but well worth trying.  It's located in the Linq plaza near the new ferris wheel.  Lots of places to eat but let hubby pick and he wanted Mexican.  It's not Mexican in the sense of the word that we normally in the US think of that type of food.  While they have tacos and typical sounding food, it's anything but typical.  We went twice while we were in Vegas, the first night by accident, the second was planned.  First night both of us had tacos.  Hubby had lobster tacos which had a deep fried batter and came with rice and beans.  He said they were really good and since there were three of them he was a happy camper.  I had grilled shrimp tacos, yummy as well.  Knew I couldn't eat all the tacos so ate one with the tortilla and the other two I ate the filling out of them.   We also got guacamole which was amazing.  It has pomegranate seeds which sounds strange but is really really good.  Many different types of margaritas yum.  One of the best I'd had lately.  Second time we went back we decided to try enchiladas.  Hubby got pork and I got sweet corn.  Even though the tortillas are smaller than what you buy in the store and I'm thinking are home made, the dishes all come with four enchiladas and neither one of us could eat all our meal, especially since we had more guacamole.  We ordered margaritas and when they came, they literally tasted horrible.  We called the server over, she tasted one and wrinkled her nose.  Apparently the bartender who made them was new and didn't know his stuff.  She went to a different bartender and got us new drinks and said she had the new bartender pour a bit in a cup so she could taste and make sure it was all it was supposed to be.  Talk about great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don margarita. Yummy

i2sOhVO56gfi_urg7dbWTw.text: Fajitas were delicious and the pitcher of margaritas was just what we needed when we landed in Vegas  after a 4 hour flight.  We were seated quickly and the service was quick and the staff attentive.  Visited on a Weds night around 10pm. Will definitely go back.

kzz9WuUrY9l6j9QupQ5SfQ.text: The food is good. The location is amazing for people watch and seat outside.  They sometimes have the $3 tacos outside and thats a great deal (you have to find your own table).   HOwever $20 for 3 tacos and a small side of rice and beans is kind of pricey or at least the food amount is not as much that you can share with anyone more than 1 bite.... in my opinion but again you pay for the location and I would come back again.  The music and the people seem to be 30 crowd...which is what we were looking for.   The plus side is that it removes all the crowd who does not want to pay for it

6eeL-0DpdIQ2lsZVJ6fHmQ.text: I paid 23.20 for a 50.00 groupon.  It was a great deal for that price.  Our check came to 47 and change and I was not charged the tax.  We made a reservation through open table.  I was called that afternoon, to make sure I was keeping my reservation.  Not sure why though, the restaurant was not super crowded.  We ordered the queso with chips for 10.00.  It was decent, nice and melty.  The chips seemed freshly fried and were crisp.  They gave us some salsa on the side for free( we were told it was going to be .50).  We ordered chicken fajitas.  I asked if we could have half steak, half chicken.  The server( Jason) said they don't do that, we could add filet for 6.00 more.  It was actually 8.00 more when the check came, but no biggy.  The portion was large, we could not even eat it all.  We had to pay an additional $3.00 for more tortillas.  I got corn( very small), my wife ordered flour.  Her order had 3 tortillas.  The fajitas came with a side of rice, beans, salsa, sour cream( big plus) and a small amount of lettuce and cheese.  Beans and rice were no big deal.  Beans tasted canned.  The chicken in the fajitas was a little spicy, smeared with a greenish paste.  The flavor was good though.  All in all a decent meal for the price.  If they would not nickle and dime you for everything, I would have given them 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Accompaniments to the fajitas
Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

d5L0OThLJPRkhSbUqswAqw.text: Being local Las Vegans, we wanted to check out The Linq. I looked online prior to check out HH. Also noticed 20% off food for locals on Monday, which it is. On our way in we saw some of the food on the tables. Portions were very small. Our waitress came over, very pleasant. Told her we were there for happy hour. She took our drink order and we asked about food special for HH. She said there weren't any. So I mentioned the 20% for locals on Monday. She said we couldn't combine HH with the Locals discount. Pretty crappy. We ordered the chips and salsa for $3. Thought it was delish. Hubby had three draft beer and I had the 2/1 margueritas. The waitress was kind enough to put my second drink in a to go cup. The marguerita was good. Service was pretty slow and it was not busy. So that was a little disappointing. The decor was nice and if it was cooler outside, the patio would be nice for people watching. But I came away feeling it was a bit "tourist trappy". Would do HH for the margueritas, chips and salsa if I happened to be in the area but I don't see myself going back to the Linq.

ykbj-kNOnQsw2jy8MmSJEw.text: Came in for breakfast and had great service from Christina! She was very friendly and quick with our orders. I would definitely go back because of the service and food.

3XlP-BmIAuia9HsWj4Jpyg.text: We made a reservation for Chayo, and granted we were pretty late, but the lecture by the hostess was unnecessary... The place was empty.  And for good reason: the music was FAR too loud and the food was bland.  I've had more authentic Tex Mex in my bumfuck hometown in Maryland.

OVrF-HjbGMON2AVWTmklzQ.text: Excellent lobster tacos.  Salsa has a nice heat level.  The margaritas are sadly under par.  I ordered high end margarita and it was seriously burnt.  I also disapprove of having to pay for chips and salsa when the drinks are $14.  I would give it a four for free chips and salsa and maybe a five if they made a better margarita.

qgk33t9h1r6w8XTXGbMmsA.text: great food. great service. our server christina was very friendly and attentive. will come back again.

bDCsxN4dUPLoN5V7u4waWA.text: Christina was amazing, so nice and attentive! Request her if any way possible and the breakfast was great.

egLNW6IhaO8LBWkdg-iIAQ.text: Food is pretty good. Service is horrible. If you have all the time in the world then you MIGHT enjoy it.

Y8Qdb7HDvAoiEQska-Rlbg.text: Overly Expensive. Not good, but edible food. They have really slow service even when they are not busy and really don't seem to care that they are slow.

Qe_Z1WyWPUHvm43BxKU9ng.text: This place was a big disappointment! When you walk up, it looks very inviting, even though it has really no Mexican style to it for being called a Mexican restaurant. The place has a mechanical bull, Mexican's are known for fighting Bulls not ride them. I just hope your not very hungry or thirsty! For the prices on the menu, I expected far better food and service. They brought me 3 regular looking tacos, for $18 and when I asked for some salsa, they looked at me like I was from Mars! Obviously they don't serve very many Hispanic's like me. I'm not sure this "Mexican" restaurant / bar even has a Mexican cook. Ok now that I established that the food was not worth the stop, maybe a good drink will save this place, wrong! Don't know where they found these bar tenders, but tried two drinks, didn't think you can mess up a Margaita, but just as the bland tasting tacos, the $10 drink was not good ether. So for two guest both having the taco plate, and three drinks, the bill was just about $80. I've had far better tacos off a food truck! And the free drinks in a Casino are far better! The place obviously is meant to target foreigners and must leave a bad impression on them of the way we eat in the America!

9Z0_6dTUlWYtVNzYrfX--g.text: Great service. James hit all the marks a waiter should. The best items we tried were the soup of the day..cilantro cream..and the chorizo sopes.  The cocktails were very tasty but very small for the price. Also..what the heck is going  on with the drinking  water? It tasted like chemicals. All in all a very nice light meal. I'd Def go back to try dinner. Ask for James.

5DxjbJjuhcXg-rjDKp2nmg.text: Stopped here for breakfast this morning, and so glad we did!  Food was excellent, and our wonderful server Christina made us feel like old friends!  Would definitely go back - maybe for drinks and dinner!

Ojdw3ne9Dildb7SC-FVV3Q.text: Dissapointing service. Server inattentive. Asked if everything was ok so far......hadn't even taken our order. Skinny magarita disgustingly sweet.

9QU-3l5nEZ11vPQEShR5Zg.text: Mediocre food for the price. No napkins. I went to the bar and asked for napkins. Appetizers never showed up so we just cancelled them when the food showed up. No forks or knives - we asked for them once we got the food. In the bathroom, a lady was handing paper towels to all the customers at the sink but the toilet stalls did not have toilet paper in them. I couldn't make this up! Hysterical!!

bn7S3PryFNJq-Jh1CoGvsQ.text: Food really good. Christina was a great waitress and a lot of fun. Lobster tacos awesome.

S9RptujeuFkMP_SHTEo4zw.text: Christina was awesome, she took care of me and my friends and made our lunch experience so much fun!

zhz4rFL0iKiOU3mrtxKx6Q.text: Great ambiance and great service! We had a late dinner there last Sunday. We shared something since we were headed out drinking. The fajitas are excellent! We also had the Oaxaca cheese and potato puree and that was also yummy. Super cold beer on tap and our server was excellent.

lt2-7CFs44r2pgjxg2RY4w.text: No complaints here!  Went for Happy Hour on a busy Saturday.  We were seated right away.  I had 4 awesome margaritas and 3 delicious beer-battered lobster tacos for $40.

ZM-5bJ66ESQGz5LEDc222Q.text: Came in with a large group after making reservations.  Took about an hour and a half to get our food.  When we got it about 75% of the plates were cold.  Expected a better experience from a place such as this in Las Vegas.  The manager took care of the bill which was nice but I would not recommend this place to anyone else.  The plates that were warm were mediocre at best.  Save your money and go somewhere else, Las Vegas has many other places to offer.

Hdlo8LVg7_nukufF_6WGVA.text: Christina made this otherwise average experience fantastic. So many places to choose from Christina made it worth the choice.

FBMYifXwu06J69PXxrFYEg.text: Friendly staff, delicious food, and the best margaritas we have ever had !  We had the steak nachos ...so yummy, and the steak was tender and flavorful. Chad our waiter provided us with excellent service.  We will definitely return here to Chayo's on our next trip to Vegas, and we'll also recommend your restaurant to our family & friends in Hawaii.  Aloha Chayo's  !!

cQvxA69wqwb4V9EwyTEeqw.text: Outside it is a charming place. so i just went inside but then salad was so dry asked for the olive oil but they dont have olive oil... also service was not good and the food as well except fajitas.

JjtPYsBu8itZyVXrrN9Sfw.text: Get the Groupon.  $29 for 3 taco plate w/beans, rice, a small bowl of guacamole, chips & salsa, and TWO margaritas! Without the deal, this place is over priced.

Q3u4itaCX0WoqjY_LB6FnQ.text: Overpriced and completely forgettable. Minuscule appetizer portions and the worst margarita I've ever had. Bring your insulin.

cXcFDP3b6vgYH9fCvAR14A.text: Latin Music ? You name it!  great atmosphere. Always a good time here. Friends and I always go Friday nights and they always extend their hours a bit longer than 2am, usually til about 4am. Food is not that great. Last time tacos were cold, hard, and not very tasty. Way overpriced for the quality. On the other had, real good drinks! Bull riding is always fun lol

IuN5T8zTZNGrJeXyfYALsQ.text: Party of twelve.. Birthday party. Reservations days out.  We get there and its two separate tables... This is a birthday party, not a adult table and a child table. Takes my peeps a while to get there. Once everyone gets there, we place our order all at the same time. The food comes out three plates at at time, over an hour and a half period. Food is not Mexican, not even a little. Food was basic AF. No spice, no flavor, and kinda cold. The food was all WAY expensive; all at LEAST $18 a plate. The furniture was blocky and quite uncomfortable, and the menus looked like they have NEVER been wiped down in their short lives. Never got a sorry from our waiter, but did get several from the acting manager; whoever that is...   After all the ridiculousness we got 50% off the bill and some of us didn't even get our food. BTW The chips and salsa are NOT included w/ your meal. Do not WASTE your money at this place. We wanted to go to Yardhouse but they don't do reservations after 5. Terrible mistake; Chayo's.

bwqBAaWBoOpUxugTGGDLcQ.text: If you are going for a drink and a snack then expect the drinks to be weak and over priced. The service is friendly but they are clearly understaffed. The trackside guacamole had too much line so all you will taste is sour.  The best thing about the restaurant is people watching. Also, the chips are homemade.  Tips Don't order a drink they have to make Tell the guacamole maker to use a third of the usual amount of lime juice.

mzfMj_FJhidFYKoAw4BVKw.text: Bad experience from the start.  They forgot about our table after they brought chips and salsa so we had no napkins, no water no nothing no service for about 25 minutes and it was not busy just understaffed.  So I flagged down a waitress who apologized but then was snippy that we were asking for things (like really, why would a customer group of 7 expect to want to order drinks and food!).  It then took another 20  minutes to get drinks which sat at the bar getting watery.  This was my second time here and never again.  It ruined a good night.  The food is pretty good but not great and neither were the margaritas for the price.

-iejgLu7z5m6McZ7dKqC7w.text: GUESTS: 10 people  FOOD: Oaxacan Chopped Salad ($14).  TASTE: Chopped salads normally come with a plethora of toppings that are bursting with flavors.  This salad was lackluster, had barely any toppings, and the toppings on the salad were devoid of flavor.  Given the plethora of food options in Vegas, I expect that restaurants should be pulling out all the stops to keep their customers happy.  I would not recommend this salad.  Their tacos did sound good, but they seem over priced for Mexican food...  SERVICE: Our waitress was amazing.  She was on point with our beverages and was very thorough on her explanations when we had questions.  Our drinks were brought out to us almost immediately.  The restaurant has a giant rooster that you can ride (similar to an electronic bull) and our waitress helped arrange it so that some of group could ride it after we finished eating.  CLEANLINESS: Everything in the restaurant was clean.    WAIT TIME: Our group went around noon and waited approximately 20 minutes for our table to be prepped (even though there were many, many empty tables).

4HPfBgZ7go5btJhRakLGxw.text: This place has the best margaritas I've found in a long time, but I'm writing this review because of the amazing service. In particular, our server Jarryd was super friendly and was just one of the people that went out of their way without being asked. The hostess, bartenders, even the manager  made it very clear that Chayo is the place to go if you value a friendly and helpful staff. And the food was bomb too!

zj43igBFC3KiEaq3A4dRfA.text: drinks suck they tasted like cotton mouth the next day after drinking.   music was awesome  SERVICE was aweful..  what do youbexpecy from a tourist destination..

WWSniSQaTrjSlvIb-f8wJA.text: Food was ok. Waiter was beyond rude. Seated quickly, ignored for a full 17 minutes before the waiter deemed us worth the trouble of waiting on. When our food arrived, it was unceremoniously thrown/dumped onto our table. Serious attitude thrown my husbands way.  Both guys got major heartburn, yuck.  Go somewhere else.

MkofF1ywCqvgSMDNeqh97Q.text: This is my second time here. We had a great high top table half in and half out on the patio.  Beautiful day to enjoy the weather and people watching at the linq.  It was a Sunday and happy hour, however no food options for happy hour only buy on get one free margaritas $4 beer specials and well drink specials.  Our server was Chad C.  He was friendly and attentive but lost a point because I had to ask for water.  Sorry chad, but a responsible server should always server water with alcohol, especially with food.  Salsa with the chips is great and spicy...loved it.  We ordered tacos, one order shrimp, one order grilled fish, two orders ribeye.  Delicious!!!!!!!  However they should be for $18 each.  You get three small tacos making it $6 per taco. It came with a scoop of rice and a cup of beans. I guess I shouldn't complain about high prices since we are on the strip, but just be warned.  Overall price isn't a deal breaker since the food is worth it.  We will definitely go back if we are in the area, but wouldn't make a special trip to the strip for it.   Saved $36 since we did happy hour margaritas! That's a bonus.

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour drink but no happy hour food.
Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour margaritas

HvnBBua7LAex3KVHocwH5A.text: HORRIBLE service. The hostess was rude when my friend and I walked up to get seated. She just stared at us for 10 seconds and then asked "can I help you?". Um, yeah. Seat us. Once we sat down our waitress came over fairly quickly but it was all down hill from there. It took forever to get our order taken, when we asked for chips and salsa the waitress looked at me like I was asking for a pony wearing a crown.   We ordered the steak nachos, no pico and sour cream on the side. When the nachos arrived there was no sour cream, no plates and no silverware. When we got the waitresses attention to let her know the sour cream was missing she looked around the table like we were HIDING it asking "oh you didn't get it?". Seriously? 20 minutes later we got all the aforementioned items but it was too late to salvage any part of this dining experience.   The nachos was mediocre at best. Service was horrible. Unless you are starving, go somewhere else.

NfBnG4ElcOdOOIR9D8GXHg.text: Delicious food, second time dine in... I love the outdoor section had a refreshing Margarita! And the environment is great!

D27kv14TCg4njacNmQHWIA.text: Good food.  But the service really lacked.  Server seemed over whelmed with 4 tables.  Had to ask to have him tracked down to get another beer.   Never saw him after placing the order until he wad sent beck  Agree with other posters that the food is good but the waiter staff didn't show up for work.

REo7aRJI4ofV3sEzMvR6_w.text: We decided to walk down the strip and stop by at different bars and have a drink at each bar. We didn't have the best experience at some bars but when we got to this bar we were greeted right away by the bartender Colby. We ordered our drinks and decided to stay because of how beautiful the atmosphere was and how attentive he was with us. They also surprised us with a flan because we were there for our honeymoon. That made our day. We will definitely return. Thank you

k9mQIuV_oteUwPpWjIh7xg.text: We had the Botana Plate which was a lot more food than it seems at first. The best part was definitely the gorditas the chicken was well seasoned and very tender.  In addition to that we also had some chips and salsa between the two tapas my girlfriend and I were stuffed and I'm a bigger boy! Pleasantly surprised.  The Don Julio flight was a great value $21 for 3 shots! Pretty damn good!   The service of as phenomenal our server was Christina, she was super warm and friendly and went out of her way to answer all our questions about the menu. Our waters were always full and she was always on the floor so we could be flag her down easily in case we needed anything!

eQOhK6llKSKF1nAqEEQ2zQ.text: Fashionable and so Vegas, this Mexican cuisine restaurant serves some nice items in generous quantities.   The waitress was nice and fast. The bull-riding attraction in the middle of the room is funny. The ambiance and decor are posh.   We had the burrito (big and delicious), some appetizers and the seared mahi-mahi tacos (a little dry and overcooked) and a burger in a ciabatta bread (nice looking, good and juicy).   4 people, 2 appetizers, 4 entrees, 2 beers on tap and 2 ice teas, $135 without tip. Not bad for the Linq promenade.

dMIQ_RAV3p20eR1lKxbhNA.text: Christina was Awesome this morn!!!  Great Mimosas and Breakfast burrito and fastest service!!

AmuvPRU6sinoxwHsfTabRA.text: I want to give it two stars to give them the benefit of the doubt that I came in in a Thursday night at 1030pm, but considering they are open until midnight, there's just no excuse.   We were seated quickly, there were 3 servers on the floor, and only three other tables at the time. We made eye contact with each server, who all smiled at us, we had our menus closed, and not a single person came over and even offered us a glass of water. After 10min of being ignored we got up and left. We had never eaten there and it doesn't look like we ever will.

t1OLzRMb2AMQtIm4Mha0Iw.text: Christina is THE BOMB!!!! She took care of a table of 16  by herself and kicked it solid!!!!  Food was fantastic - drinks flowed - service was above and beyond!  Ask for her!

YGDKNnYEGDPjl570ZVzQvg.text: Went with the my husband to check out the quad. Ventured over here for a bite. We sat at the bar and first off they bring water right away. Being a tree huger I'm a little torn by that. I do always ask for a water to start. I ordered the Palermo and  my husband had  Pancho Via. My drink was outstanding and made with great tequila. I think they make there own house brand. The Pancho via is jalapeno  tequila watermelon and cucumber. Of course I had to try. So refreshing! I will definitely have some of those come summer time. We had the sopes and lobster tacos. Both were very good. Great dj and as others mentioned mechanical bull. Nice environment plus they have a little lounge area and balcony upstairs. This will be great in the summer.   TIP: we parked at Cesar's forum shops valet and crossed the street. I think this might be the easiest  parking.

Nw3tUjwMqB1SHQak4YMzdw.text: Went to chayos. As locals we heard they have a DJ and dancing on fridays so initially that's what made us want to go. But I guess that hasn't started for the season??? Who knows.. so we ate dinner instead the nachos were amazing and there was plenty to share between a few people. Our server Courtney was on point the whole night. He made suggestions. He kept checking in us. Going again next week

fMHBUsH7mfkbXP003g-UrA.text: The food was "ok" but pretty pricey for what you get. The staff was soooooo nice though!

Xdkiqua1FYTPFM4Pgh8yAQ.text: I tried there street tacos bc they were cooking them outside in front of there place. $3 for a good served taco with lettuce, cheese, pico and salsa. Good carne asada and chicken. But plate was super small and couldn't eat it right. Everything fell and uncomfortable to grab a taco. Should buy a little bigger plates. Put a sign that says tacos here! Because a lot of people saw me eating them and couldn't see the place.

06hwMduUFAdPfUHSKUTV0g.text: Kyle was absolutely awesome. Had the shrimp ceviche! This is a must on you next trip!

9Bkm4vK4dpnHlqYn-GoLHQ.text: Great service from Christina !! We had a large party and she was very accommodating , on point and took great care of us! Highly recommend this place !

qIzMDTPsEAL8mpKL95bl8w.text: Service is not great . The hostess sat us down and after two other parties and 10 minutes later we decided to move to the bar to see if we had better luck . The bartender was on a bathroom break for another 10 minutes . Over all not a great experience .will not come back

4VaWYuXzddqyUiddfhnEsA.text: The service was the biggest thing that stands out here. Drinks and food are good but just as pricey as anywhere but our server Christina who not only had a wonderful personality and a beautiful smile was super fantastic and attentive. She's a keeper and should be paid more.

M6BZlK2BQsaJDurDqTCoEQ.text: The food is very good, the service is very good...so why the two stars. When we received the bill there was a 4.17% additional fee called CNF. The waiter explained people who live in Las Vegas know what the charge is. I said I've been a resident for over five years and never heard of it. He explained it was a franchise fee. Mmmm. He seemed to represent it was a tax. Doing some research it turns out it was just another charge to ripp off patrons. The money goes to the owners of the restaurant. They have the "fee" as a odd percentage to give people the impression it's a tax. The strip hotels continue to rip off tourists and that's why my spouse and I rarely go to the strip anymore.

DaNTUy9lc8DRSbs-Cc3_Jw.text: Fantastic tequila offering.  Staff is knowledgeable and friendly and answered a ton of questions.   Didnt have food but the salsa with the chips was fresh with just a THE right amount of heat.  Rachel, the superb bartender was amazing!!! So friendly and welcoming and gave us tickets to the gun show when she shook our margaritas complete with a smile.  Fantastic gave us the hometown feel on the strip, would come back to see her!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KUoqDdSHoZzs-Fjo1X_MQA.text: Just showed up to Vegas and decided to eat at Chayo because we are staying at the Linq. The food is good, but the service is out of this world.   Christina was our server and she rocks! Awesome personality and she really made the experience for us. Hopefully if you take the time to read this then you end up with Christina as your server.

Jgp6KOH1f1GJMAebcF8P6Q.text: What a bunch of flash with NO food. Only good for show. Good is good but portions very small. I expect for$25 I'd get a meal that would fill me up. But instead I get a plate full of onions n bell pepper.   Skip of you want to eat. Or drink  The drinks are so small. For $9 I'd Expect a 9oz drink.   Just one one of those high priced tourist places. Save your $$$$.

xOmPKzSYV0xxyiWuNh_09w.text: Giving four stars because the service and atmosphere was hella good but the food was eh. Anyways, Lance Apollo was my server and idk what kind of stripper name that is but his service was great, really nice guy, always made sure to check in and everything. kh3oRHWbB2bJ6bWfmaoY4g.text: This is an amazing establishment. It is located on The LinQ. We sat outside, surprisingly it was very comfortable and cool thanks to the misters. It felt as if we were dining inside with air conditioning. We were greeted right away by the server.   chips and Salsa. Chips were seasoned and somewhat spicy. The salsa was Fresh.  empanada is amazing I definitely recommend it.  I had the Chicken Fajitas. It was an amazing dish. Can't wait to try everything else on the menu.  The margarita was good too

jOCHBa2ofGeGBl3YtNRFKQ.text: We came in for dinner before dancing and were not disappointed. The atmosphere is modern cool with a mexican flare. I love the wall of wrestler masks and the mechanical bull is a great crowd drawer.   The drinks, the food...sooooo good! I had the Senorita and lobster fajitas with yuca fries! Yum!! My drink was so delicious, tasty and not watered down; which is rare on the strip! There was plenty of lobster fir my fajitas, no skimping there and the yuca fries were thick and crispy! I can't wait for it to get warmer and they open up the outdoor patio!   A great place to eat and feel fancy with a 20% discount for locals. Hurry and visit!!

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Fajitas!

81MFh_1r8bWtoSsPFH2s8Q.text: Shrimp diablo was phenomenal, atmosphere is excellent.  Corbin, the bartender was friendly and knowledgeable, and his margaritas were delicious.  I would recommend this place to everyone.

A1H7XEviH3Pp_sKDqwjQkQ.text: Really good mexican food! I'm glad there's a new restaurant on the block to mix things up a bit. I came later in the night and they had a dj spinning some good music. Definitely going to return.  con - ran out of salsa verde by the time I got there smh :(

csoKEjNUGHezvIb5r6IlXw.text: Service was AMAZING. Lauren and Chad were awesome entertainment. The food was perfect not too spicy but definitely not bland. By far my new favorite Mexican restaurant!!!!!   Laurren and Pam

IwGZc8a2R4li3m3M4onE5A.text: Went to celebrate and watch all the Friday NCAAM game. Because of lent, I couldn't eat meat. They had phenomenal non-meat options. Had a blast with good food and great drinks.

Bby2vpj47lgGM3ImwC2n_w.text: Came here on a Saturday for lunch... the place wasn't super busy and we were seated promptly on the outside patio. It took about 10 mins to get a waiter to take our drink order and by then we knew what we wanted so we ordered our food too... we got our drinks a while later probably another 10 mins, and 10 mins after that we got our guacamole appetizer. We finished all our guacamole and we're still waiting on our food.... for another 15 mins  I ordered the filet mignon fajitas and my husband ordered the surf and turf tacos. His came out lukewarm and mine came out nice and hot on the skillet plate. The food was delicious and had great flavor. The onions and peppers from the fajitas really brought out the flavor of the meat. Guess what happened when we were done with our meal? We waited another 20 minutes until someone came by and we asked them to get our bill.   We were originally going to the buffet at Cesar's but decided to try to save a little time and money... we didn't save either by coming here!! Lol...    Food was great, service was lousy... probably won't be back :(

wtAKtlksQeGtq7BnsS68Fw.text: Ok first of all where ever your sitting move GO TO THE BAR, BENJAMIM is amazing!!! He's helpful and he's on top of his game.  I wish I could give more than 5 stars, HES CUTE AF TOO

yVfXt79C_YeS2ae5OGR-qA.text: They season the tortilla chips which gave it a little spice. The salsa had a little bit of kick as well. The guacamole was fresh and did not disappoint.  The service was phenomenal.  10/10 would recommend the margarita!!!! Pitcher of the house reposado tequila margarita was only  $30.  The refried beans and Mexican rice were terrible. Entrees come with pickled vegetables - very unique and yummy! The nachos were huge but were mediocre. The chicken taquitos were delicious and not bland at all.  I think this place could get 4 stars depending on what you order on the menu.

2mUwkgODOCCy9GbUMovF9A.text: Went for breakfast. Sat on the patio, buzzing atmosphere with a fun view. Awesome service!  lip smackingly delicious Bloody Mary.  The huevos rancheros dish was great. The refried beans were on point, and pulled pork was phenomenal. Corn tortillas were excellent.  I would recommend this restaurant and the dish! Good job!

JpNqN8vHQ5lyUi1htcvz0Q.text: Tequila and tacos always catches my eye, so of course I was excited to try this place! This was the first stop we had in Vegas, so the prices were a little rough to take in at first, $20 for a couple tacos is a little steep, that being said it is Vegas. Overall there were a lot of menu options and the staff was helpful and friendly. I tried the house margarita and the nachos (no meat). The margarita was perfect! It was very fresh and a great taste. The nachos had a good place but were a little dry and plain, they need more salsa... queso... guacamole... something. The top chips were good but the huge mound underneath were just plain chips. Overall though this was a good experience and I recommend this place.

ATyW8rRFmMLEHA49zG4ntg.text: Awesome time at Chayo. Amazing food! They have an upstairs patio. Great place to drink, eat and people watch. Hosts an awesome view of the Linq lane.

J6FcbplXVLgyCMeyY02dRQ.text: I was in here yesterday! My server was amazing! Her name was Miranda! She was her attentive and had a great personality..the food was good as well but I'm huge on customer service, and she will be a reason for me to return to this place!thanks again Miranda!

r0eV11lDE5q5QLX4cGhIDQ.text: Nice selection of tequilas. Its pricey since it's on the strip, but it was a good place to grab a drink and people watch.

8C72CjmXImDGTszS7U-InA.text: For starters- the drinks were all watered down. This includes micheladas, coffee, mimosas like all of them. Due to this my group of friends were asking normal questions such as : is there anything on the menu that's stronger ? Different options ? The waitress was super rude and was making it very clear that she was irritated. We were trying to keep a positive vibe but she was definitely killing it. Over all, the food was also bad. Steak was dry, chilaquiles were ok, and enchiladas were also gross. Hard pass on this place !!

B1G97_uSZUopbov8Nj6snA.text: I love Latin MUSIC! Banda, Bachata, Merengue, Rock en Espanoil, you name it, I love it!   We ended our night here and started our morning here! At night they offered Latin music all around. I love dancing to it! We all had a great time!  Happy hour was from 2pm-6pm and they had $1 Coronitas, but only at the bar. The food wasn't all that great so I'm taking away one star. The service was good as well. It was a nice open area for lunch with everyone.   The only thing is ... I was a bit disappointed the rooftop was closed for a private event.. Other than that.. can't go wrong with the $1 Coronitas.

SAp1amyC1ytSiYQ0Tjnr6w.text: The tacos are whack. Did the menu change? Came here a few years ago, and had some delicious carne Asada tacos. What we got last night was literally some carne asada on a plate with rice and beans and tortillas to make our own tacos. I'm still not entirely sure we were served what we ordered, because I don't get tacos to make my own....anyways, the cucumber margarita I had was refreshing, and the chips and guacamole were good.  If you're coming here for chips, dip, and drinks, you'll be fine but you'll want to skip dining here. Paid like, $100 bucks to be disappointed.

1mEyOIwG9FJLRSj8AkNU0Q.text: I gotta say I was very disappointed with the quality of the food we ate tonight.  I ordered the chicken tacos and the chicken was very dry and very bland.  The service was ridiculously slow for a night that wasn't overly busy.  With so many choices to eat in the general vicinity that are really good options I would suggest you up your game on the quality of the food and the service.  Glad we tried it but will not come back.

0tSm830pVpQgXfCoT2wXxQ.text: Food tastes out of a jar or can. Service was sporadic. Was here last year and had a much better experience. Maybe just an off night.

SlXAoofGAPRdtdWU0f9Ssg.text: The food isn't authentic and the hosts was rude by telling us that she had to pay for our food then walked away. Yeah we asked for the manager. My co-workers and I will never come again. Miranda the host BITCH! And this this the second the review I ever wrote! Don't come here, the manager sucks balls.  Done.

p_hdr_jp5qceiakLFYScnw.text: We were in the area for a private event at Brooklyn Bowl, but wanted to grab something to eat beforehand. I love Mexican food so this choice was a no brainer. The hostess said it would be a 5 minute wait, and it was, but then she asked if we minded sitting upstairs on the patio. I said we didn't mind since it was pretty cool down there, but the upstairs patio was crazy hot (it was over 100 that day) with no misters or fans and blaring music. We ended up moving inside upstairs, which was also extremely warm. All of this would have been not too big of a deal, except for the fact that there were multiple open tables downstairs (where it was pleasantly cool).   I digress. I got the chicken fajitas and they were just OK. Pretty lacking in flavor, but a decent portion. The grilled corn with a spicy mayo type mixture and cheese was easily the best part of the meal.   The service was prompt and attentive.   All in all-- it was ok, but there are too many nearby restaurants to check this one out again.

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fajitas. Bland but good portion size.

2OCVhpIA8C0IXKAcV6RBeA.text: Best servicer ever!!  CHRISTINA was so awesome I think I proposed to her before I left. She was honest about drinks and food and I left fat happy and drunk, her energy was so awesome She made my experiences amazing  If I can give her 10 stars I would.

WOxs2bX_EqoTjMjBd39NFg.text: Decided to go around 7 for dinner. Really nice place, vibe and some delicious food. As much as I wanted to love it more than I actually did it's not the best when expectations ain't met not by the food but by the employees. Our waiter was so nice and always making sure we were good. Now the two lady's in the front seating you were where the bad experience started first of all very rude screaming "hu?" Every other word I would say, now I asked my waiter if there was any possible way to get two tacos only she informed me that i could get them from their vendor outside the restaurant and bring them in or well she thought, I proceeded to do just that even thought I had ordered my aguachiles already. As I'm walking back in one of the employees (one of the lady's in the front ) tells me that I couldn't bring that and I told her I was told that I could, now I totally understand if I can't I simply can't and rules are rules. As I'm trying to explain and comprehend she is starting to become very rude and screaming at me that she's calling her manager as I'm trying to figure out where was the waiter that told me I could and also what I should do. She calls the manager I see him and I stand there with my food that I bought from the vendor outside and walks right by me when I tried talking to him and talks to my waiter, food is great like said ( aguachiles could've been spiced up a bit but personal preference)  but everything relies on costumer service. How could I enjoy my food when an employee attacks me with attitude not like I know I was doing anything wrong. Definitely was thinking of recommending this place to friends and family in Seattle but with costumer service like that never, no matter how good the food is there it's not worth being harassed Over.

CRGAApzyWW3RD1bSAMjsEA.text: Came here on an off night. On a Monday, was hoping some good service since they weren't busy but our waitress was really off. Food was good, nothing great though. We had ordered shrimp tacos, short rib enchiladas, and Al pastor tacos.  The nachos was the best thing we got. The steak nachos were amazing but everything else including the service was sub par.  Save your time and money, go elsewhere on the promenade.

1bh3JJKONleS4DJ60hQ8Yw.text: Giving this place a 3 star due to the poor customer service. We had to ask for a waiter since no one came to help us even though it was 5pm dinner time. The drink person brought us waters and he said he would get a waiter. When the waitress finally arrived, she apologized and we were ready to order. We got our appetizers before our drink order which we had to then ask again about. Someone other than our waitress brought out the food and our waitress never came back to check on us. The food was decent and good portion sizes. We also had to ask for the check since no waitress was around again. Someone from our group of 4 people asked where the restroom was and they told us to go next door to the casino since it was closer. Turns out the hostess said the bathroom was on the second floor of the restaurant and much closer. Seems like employees here do not care and need better training!

5-7hqm68ZK1MBGyARee6yw.text: I came here for a spouse connection event and they had a taco bar set up in the upstairs area. I also had a sangria and a fresa fresca and they were both very good. The fresa fresca is pretty pricy for just one drink though and I didn't know it was an almost $16 drink when I ordered it because I saw the bartender making one and I said that it looked good and just ordered it based off that. I should have checked the menu first. The taco bar was really great though and the chicken for the tacos tasted great with great seasoning. The guacamole was fantastic as well. I enjoyed the tres leches as well. I would definitely come back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert bar for an event in the upstairs area

73V8ZUpK0Jtzfnpa_Ezgog.text: Had the munchies after getting off the plane and landed here, Chayo's Mexican Kitchen, located to next to the Flamingo. They had happy hour, so we took advantage of that and ordered one of everything.   The steak and chicken tacos had a lot of meat and was served with onions, cilantro, and green sauce. The wings were awesome--Coated with a chipotle hot sauce and served with a side of cilantro cream. Asada fries and cheese nachos weren't a big hit with us, but their House Blanco Margarita rocked, especially since the bartender was able to flavor it for us: one jalapeno and the other watermelon.  Great little place.

hsHA1FGnNS92AjhnI1g3sQ.text: We went here for happy hour as they had some great deals and my mom and I just wanted a few things to share for a reasonable price. I have to say I was pretty impressed with the food and drinks. The price was wonderful too.  We ordered two steak street tacos for $5, hot chipotle sauce chicken wings with cilantro crema, which there were five decent sized wings for $5, and then cheesy nachos for $5! They also had margaritas for $5 each as well which they tasted great!!! We couldn't finish all of the food either! So for the 3 happy hour apps and 2 margaritas it was only $28.83 which included tax. I threw in $5 for a tip as the service wasn't that wonderful.  I did look at the regular menu and the prices seemed pretty pricey, but it is Vegas. Everything is pricey. I would expect their food to be really good considering their $5 happy hour apps tasted great.

4m_vWu37BAhTI1XPKlt4kw.text: Food was great, and had excellent taste. We sat in the patio area, the view was great. Our waitress was awesome. The drinks were amazing and very delicious. The mangonada was supper yummy, and the watermelon cocktail as well. I had some diablo shrimp, there are spicy but not extremely spicy. We also had corn on the cob, need a little of extra salt to give it a little more flavor but still yummy. My boyfriend had pollo al pastor burrito and it was delicious as well. For 2 drink, 2 main course, and an order of corn in the cob being about $100

t1UZawKJYBFhZnNSQ24dKg.text: I usually love to dine here but this time around the food was meh. I got the queso duo which was good - not the best but it was ok. We also got the enchiladas and the chicken was a bit dry. I ended up not finishing it because of this reason but my bad liked his chicken veracruzana.   Used to love this spot but I'm not sure if this was a one off visit or if it's really gone downhill.   Service here was good though.

4InCq9QHlqIb3RHC3huVRA.text: We decided to give this place a try for two reasons. One, it was in our hotel and two, we were able to get a discount (50% off enchilada entrees) with our Vegas discount card.  *Pro-tip: If you purchase show tickets via the Ticket For Tonight stand, you'll get a vegas discount card that is good for an extensive list of restaurants!   We tried their beef tips and green chile enchiladas. Both were pretty good and had great flavor profiles. The beef tips were slightly overcooked as well as the rice, but overall it was all good. The service was okay and the food came out pretty quickly as we asked for it to be expedited to make our show on time. Not sure if I'd return for the food at full-price as I do think there are other good options at their price point ~$20 per meal, but they're worth a try if you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Tip Enchilada
Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green Chile Chicken Enchilada

_h8EQsG2ORtuQ4VW8clQuA.text: Omg this place is amazing! I don't know if I am in love with breakfast or lunch! The is food alway amazing to me and the staff is always super helpful on recommending. I definitely am grateful that the waiter recommended the Churro French Toast. That was definitely a life changer for me, I could eat that all day. They even add cereal and fresh berries as a topping. I didn't even need any syrup, the French Toast has the perfect balance of sweetness, I was only bummed I had to share with my table. Next time I might have to order two so I can share.  I definitely like that this is located at the Linq, I can eat till I am stuff and walk it off. I also love the outdoor patio, you can definitely enjoy the weather (if it isn't bipolar) and do some people watching if that's your thing!

Photo of Chayo Mexican Kitchen + Tequila Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7o9XejKZwyZV9FcFmQaUYg.text: Restaurant is located is the middle of the Linq promenade.   Unfortunately the service was poor which started from the wait time to get a table.   Lots of empty tables available but still waited about 45 minutes for a table.    After we were seated, the waiter asked us if anyone stated that there would be delay if about 20-30 minutes to get our food.  After waiting 45 minutes for a table, we really didn't have a choice at that point.   The food was average, drinks watered down, service slow and wait staff not attentive.    So many other choices for food so I would definitely pass on this restaurant

mQa5aGJiN0aR1ENJUiVytA.text: I ordered the Chicken Al Pastor.  It was dry, tasteless and offensive.  I was actually offended after eating it.  If I were starving, and you put a plate of it in front of me I would gratefully use the meat and taco shell to roll into a tight ball in which I would then plunk down a pigeon with, or similar garbage bird to then eat instead, after baiting it with the Mexican rice.  I don't normally make a big deal about a restaurant's service unless it was outrageous -- and it wasn't outrageously so I'm not even letting it negatively impact my review here -- but it wasn't good: slow to get a server at the table, ordered an appetizer that was forgotten and brought out after dinner, etc.  I cannot in good faith write a 5-star review for a sit-down Mexican restaurant that does not give you chips and salsa when you order.  That's called Taco Bell, and as a self-respecting adult, I no longer have room in my stomach for Taco Bell.  So, there's an automatic one-Star deduction off the bat.  We ordered the guacamole as an appetizer (which was forgotten and came after dinner).  It was terrible and the stale chips tasted like they came out of a bag.  Even me, a gringo, could have made my own guac better than this back in Buffalo, which is to say I would have bought it from Wegman's.  In touristy areas, with chain type restaurants and when I'm really hungry, I sometime go against the wisdom of many other Yelp reviewers, such as with this time, and I was supremely disappointed that I did.  Don't stop at the hostess stand here.... if you're intent on eating Mexican-ish food and at the Linq then walk two or three more doors down to Yardhouse instead.

I-gQBabQdtHjBSvdb9ZdOA.text: Although it is a Holiday~Labor Day,we were seated quickly. A lil slow on service. We ordered 2 appetizers, and a  Michelada and a Bloody Mary. Bloody is just alright. Nothing spectacular. The Michelada taste more like a bloody as if they used the bloody Mary mix. . As for the short rib flautas,that was good. The chorizo cheese dip with chips just OK. Nothing spectacular. As a Mexican Authentic restuarant, we all receive FREE chips and salsa. BUT not here you must pay,its listed in the menu as an appetizer. Just puzzling to me. I frequent many restaurants across the US and Mexico. If you want your customers to drink more, you should offer this as a freebie not charge. Ambiance during the day is not too noisey,very relaxed,great music playing n the background, very nice and cold inside the restuarant. A plus especially when its over 80degrees. I would definitely try this place at night to check out the scenery. I would recommend for large  and small parties. I would recommend thia restuarant to encourage servers to wear name badges. I couldn't address my server by name. Just food for thought. Here are my few pics for your viewing pleasure.

G5vyKuXnEnAIBd-yQ5b7-w.text: Was craving a pre dinner margarita but unfortunately this place was disappointing.  The coconut margarita was almost too tart to drink.  Took the bartender forever to make my drink because she had to "hunt down" a margarita glass (huh? It's a mexican place)  Not to mention the margarita glass she found was just a decorative pint glass.  Was here on shift change and neither shift was welcoming or engaging.  The only bathroom was in the upstairs bar (which is a pain if you've been drinking all day, or are like me and are wearing painful heels lol).  Better drinks or better service could def be found elsewhere.
